Efua sells fish and cassava in Nkontrodo, near Elmina. Efua has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a mason. 

Efua has been selling fish and cassava for five years now . She is responsible for helping her husband pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of fish and cassava to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to grow her food-selling business.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fish and cassava to sell in the market.

loans.name: Menana

texts.en:
Menana is single and has two children.  She sells pomade lotion for hair, powders to freshen the skin, and pots, which she has been doing for one year..   Menana sells her products in Nkontrodo near Elmina.   

Menana is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more pots to sell.  She is responsible for supporting herself and her children and saving for their future. She hopes to use the profits to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase pots to sell..

loans.name: Bella Flor Group

texts.en:
Women throughout the world like to feel beautiful, just because they are women. The ten women of the trust bank “Bella Flor” or beautiful flower feel just this way. Their village is called Santiago Zamora in Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. This group was formed 5 years ago, but over time some people left the group and new members have joined.

Rosa is a very enthusiastic and active 43-year-old married woman with five children. She is pleased and proud that each of them attends school. Her first child is in the 10th grade and she happily anticipates his graduation from high school. Rosa, herself, was a teacher for three years and then her contract expired. She searched for another teaching position, but unable to secure one, she decided to enter the textile business. Currently, she is in her 4th loan cycle and employs five workers. She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials as she has increased demand with new customers.
As the president of the “Bella Flor” trust bank, Rosa encourages her fellow members to confidently move forward. She places a great deal of emphasis on the responsibility that each member has with Friendship Bridge. Rosa is most appreciative of her own loan and the impact it has made in her life. Her feelings are shared by her fellow trust bank members.

In her own words: “Thanks to everyone who has been so generous in giving us a loan. This loan really helps us in our daily lives. Together with our husbands, we can make progress for ourselves, our families and our community.”

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her textile business.

loans.name: Gaviotas De Chuisuc Group

texts.en:
One year ago, a new Trust Bank, “Gavitas de Chuisuc”, was formed in Chuisuc, a rural community in the State of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. This town is located in the Western Highlands, about 45 minutes from Guatemala’s second largest city, Quetzaltenango. Most of the population is involved in some form of commercial venture.

The Trust Bank has 18 members and is in their third loan cycle. Their average age is 38 years with three of the members being single and the rest being married. The married women have an average of four children each. The income that these ladies earn enables them to provide a better standard of living, health and education for their children.

Ana, 35 years of age, is the treasurer of the trust bank. She is married and has three children who range in age from five to fourteen and each of them attends school. Ana is in her 2nd loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and her business consists of weaving textiles, either colorful “huipiles”, the rectangular shirts that the indigenous women wear, or “cortes”, which are their skirts. Ana needs to secure a loan to buy two looms so that she can increase production. She has sixteen employees (8 women and 8 men) who are excellent workers, especially at this time of the year. In Guatemala, Easter is a big and very popular holiday and as such, families like to purchase new clothes. Ana is well aware of this increased demand and has increased production. The increased earnings will be well used. In addition, Ana owns a stall at the lively market in Totonicapan, a large community that is near her village, where people sell textiles.

The 18 women of the trust bank, “Gavitas de Chuisuc”, are amazed, pleased and grateful, that they have received financial support in the form of loans from people that they don’t know.
These ladies have a desire to overcome obstacles and move forward. With their loans, they can transform their own lives, as well as elevate the standard of living for their families and communities.

loans.use: to buy two looms for her weaving business.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en:
Olimpia and her husband Pepe are Mexican artisans who specialize in creating copper vases, wall art and home décor. They would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including copper, paint and enamels. Olimpia has been selling through NOVICA since 2006.

This is her story: "Our families have worked with copper for generations now and we've been around it all our lives. That’s how we learned to create utilitarian and decorative objects from this noble metal. We design and craft casseroles, vases, bells and more. We sometimes apply a layer of gold or silver to make it more beautiful. The love and constancy we put into our work as a couple have yielded incredible fruits as we show the world a bit of our beloved state of Michoacán."

"We thank you for your interest in our art through this microcredit. Above all, thank you for your trust in us."

You can use the link below to view Olimpia's handcrafted copper art on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5498

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials including copper, paint and enamels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics and material to make clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is grateful to the people who gave towards her first loan. Her business is picking up well, and the extra income she received helped her repay her first loan on time. 

Kadzo had started selling locally made detergents and roofing materials referred to here as "makuti". They are made from coconut twigs and are a good source of insulation against the coastal sunshine and heat. 

Kadzo would like to invest more into the business, and is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase more detergents and roofing materials for sale.

loans.use: To purchase detergents and roofing materials for sale.

loans.name: Mustiri

texts.en:
Mustiri lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married businessman and owns a farming business. He has kept poultry for eight years, and employs one person on the farm. Besides this, he is also a land and estate sales/rental agent. 

Mustiri learnt about Milango through friends, who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of funds for business growth, a problem he sees as being fixed through this loan. Mustiri is applying for a loan of 57,500 Kenya shillings to buy more chicks, feed, and drugs, and to expand the rearing area. He will use the extra income to develop a residential house for his family so he can stop renting.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, feed, and drugs, and to expand the rearing area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs, and pay for ploughing and planting labour costs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: el Sr. Juan tiene 24 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 3 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de villa esperanza,  el Sr. Juan aprendió este oficio de su padre quien también es agricultor y le ayuda con la siembra así que desde pequeño el Sr. Juan es agricultor, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Juan va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara su calidad de vida  el Sr. Juan es una  persona joven   responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Juan is twenty-four years old and has one son who is three years old.  He makes a living in agriculture, planting a variety of vegetables like potatoes, yucca, and corn on his plot of land, which is located in the community of Villa Esperanza.  

Juan learned this trade from his father, who was also a farmer.  He helps his father with the planting, and so, since he was a little boy, Juan has been a farmer.  

This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  Juan is going to use the loan to plant yucca; this includes preparing the land.  His reason for requesting this loan is to obtain the resources for the planting and to be able to survive.  He will use the benefits to improve his quality of life.

Juan is a young, responsible, and hardworking person, and he feels thankful to the institution for the offered support; this is the only activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to plant yucca.

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Non, 37, is married with two children. He is residing in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. All of his children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, he and his wife have been planting cassava on 2 hectares of farmland for nine years. Together, they can earn about 80,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Non is a first loan cycle client with VisionFund. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. He wants to use his loan to buy seeds for his plantation, and will use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. He hopes to increase his crop yield so as to sell it for a good price to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his cassava plantation.

loans.name: Kimhoeun's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Kimhoeun is 41 years old and has two children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Kimhoeun has been farming rice and planting cassava for almost 20 years, earning about 15,000 KHR but is able to save about 8,000 KHR each day.
Kimhoeun’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. The past loan has helped her improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a large crop from her rice paddy and cassava planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother to two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family a modest simple life in a small village near Jenin. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Mayson's son is studying at the university. Mayson wants to help her son to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so she is requesting a USD 1,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her son cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for her son and improve the family's living conditions. Mayson is photographed with her husband.

loans.use: to pay the university fees of her son.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.ru:
Tarana arenduyut nebolshoe pomeshenie v kachestve salona krasoti. Ona  vmeste s pomoshnicey rabotaet parikmaxerom. U Tarani 8 let opita v etoy sfere. Ona ochen vospitannaya I terpelivaya zhenshina i za eti kachestva klienti ee uvajayut I sovetuyut svoim blizkim I znakomim ee salon. V budushem ona ochen xochet kupit novie neobxodimie veshi kak fen, rascheski dla raznix form ukladok, izmenit dizayn I obustroit salon po novomu. 
Tarane 36 let, ona zamujem I mat’ dvux malenkix detey vozrastov 6 i 3. K sojaleniu u nee boleet malenkiy rebenok, sin. Na ego lechenie im neobxodima summa v razmere 1000 AZN. Ona obratilas za kreditom v Kiva partner VFAC, eti dengi uydut na operaciyu I na medikamenti.
texts.en:
Tarana rents a small space which she manages as a beauty salon. She works there as a hairdresser with a co-worker and has eight years of experience in this business. Her clients find her to be well-mannered and patient which makes them recommend her salon to their friends and families. In the future, Tarana wants to acquire several items for her business, such as a hair dryer and various combs for different hair sets; she would also like to change her salon's layout and design. 

Tarana is thirty-six years old, married and has two small children, ages 6 and 3. Her youngest son is, unfortunately, very sick and she needs 1000 AZN for his treatment. So she's asking for a loan in order to obtain money that will go towards his operation and medication.

loans.use: To cover the medical treatment and surgery for her little son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Chuung

texts.en:
A father of two schoolchildren residing in Kampong Cham Province, Chung is 38 years old and married. On two hectares each of rice and cassava cropping, he is able to earn up to 32,900 KHR per day. This is the second cycle for Chung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).The past loan, which he has completely repaid, has enabled him to support his business and stabilize his lifestyle.

For this new cycle, he will use his loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to boost his crop productivity and to get a high yield in order to buy an additional plot of land to grow rubber tree seedlings on.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 33, is widowed and lives with her family in a village in the Moung Russey District. She has two children, one of whom is in school, while the other is still too young for school. To make a living, she has been working as a tailor for seven years, and she supplements that income by selling grocery items in the village. The current business earns her family about 54,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. This is Chreb’s first microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper vehicle for her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family to use.

loans.name: Ngek's Group

texts.en:
Ngek is 34  years old and has a total of seven children, all of whom are still in school. She lives in a rural area in Seim Reap province’s Srey Snom district. To support her big family, Ngek and her husband are rice farmers and have been farming for ten years. Together, the can earn about 10,000 KHR each day. Ngek has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid back her loan which she used to improve livelihood.

Ngek is the leader of a five-member group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Ngek hopes her loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and she also hopes to grow more rice to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.ru:
Хидаяту 56 лет, он фермер с 10 летним стажем. Он женат и у него сын который помогает ему в хозяйстве. Сфера его деятельности это животноводтсво и земледелие. Он продает молоко, мясо, огурцы и помидоры. Кроме этого его сын зарабатывает деньги от работы как мастер по ремонту и приносит заработок домой. 
В основном Хидаят занимается земледелием и у него есть такие трудности как слабая oтоплительная система в парнике. Он надеется исправить эту проблему, обеспечит парник постоянным электкричеством и развивать земледелие.
texts.en:
Hidayat is fifty-six years old, married and has a son. For the past ten years, he's made a living as a farmer and is helped by his son in running the business. Hidayat sells milk, meat, cucumbers and tomatoes. Additionally, his son helps out by working as a repairman and bringing home part of his salary. 

Hidayat has a very weak heating system in his greenhouse and he's asking for a loan in order to fix this problem. If he could supply his greenhouse with constant electricity, the temperature problem would be solved and he would be able to increase his farming.

loans.use: To improve his greenhouse's electrical system and expand his farming.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Pursat Province’s Kror Kor District, Tha is 33 years old, a widow with five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living by selling chickens, rice, sugar and other items. This business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Tha’s Group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans. Tha’s portion has helped to support her current business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. She wants to use her portion to buy more chicken, rice and sugar to sell. She hopes to receive more income from her current business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She has two children and she manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a grocery store. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP5,000 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Imelda hopes to have a supermarket and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
For the past year, Bader, a 23-year-old single man, has had a cafe that serves both hot drinks and soft drinks. As the only cafe in the area, his enterprise is a profitable one, and Bader enjoys a good reputation among his many loyal clients. It is his only source of income.

Bader is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to buy new chairs and a new television set. These purchases will satisfy his existing clients and attract more, thereby increasing his income and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and a television set for the cafe.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. She sells yams, sandals, and fish in the Nkontrodo community near Elmina, which she has done for the past 25 years. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to help her husband in paying their family's general expenses. She will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of yams, sandals and fish to sell in the market and meet the needs of her diverse clientele. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to develop her various trades further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of yams, sandals and fish to sell in the market and meet the needs of her diverse clientele .

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es: Adriana de 35 años de edad, habita al suroccidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 18 años.  Allí se dedica a la actividad comercial en las líneas de ropa y calzado. Desde hace 3 años inició este negocio con el fin de aumentar los ingresos de hogar, apoyada por su cónyuge que es técnico electricista y fue quien le suministró el capital inicial con el que ha ido creciendo. Ella viaja y trae  desde otra ciudad de Colombia, artículos que compra en mayores volúmenes a proveedores de los que obtiene importantes descuentos, con los que ofrece productos de buena calidad y a precios justos en su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará calzado y vestidos deportivos, y ampliará su surtido con artículos a la moda. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda trabajando día a día, para lograr ahorros con los cuales logre su propósito.
texts.en:
Adriana is 35 years old and lives in the southwest of the city, with her husband and their 3 children, ages from 12 to 18. Here she pursues commerce in clothing and shoes. Some 3 years ago, Adriana began her business with the goal of increasing household income, aided by her husband, who is an electrical technician. He provided the initial capital, with which the business has since been growing. 

Adriana travels to another Colombian city and brings back articles she purchases in large volume from providers who offer her important discounts. This allows Adriana to offer products of good quality at just prices in her market.

Now, Adriana is applying for a Kiva loan, her 1st financing through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy shoes and sports clothing, and expand her selection with articles in style. Her goal is to improve conditions in her home, working day to day to achieve savings that will advance her proposition.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sports clothing, and to expand her selection of articles in style.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros, de 42 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 15 años quienes aun viven en su casa propia, la cual compro con el fruto de su esfuerzo .El trabajo de Milagros consiste en la venta de ropa. Realiza su trabajo por las diferentes calles de la ciudad ,entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares o también de manera ambulatoria en los diversos mercados de la ciudad. Trae prendas de vestir desde otra ciudad hasta donde se dirige personalmente para seleccionar las vestimentas de mejor calidad y de los mejores diseños. Lleva trabajando así ya por 04 años, lo hace sola ya que al separarse de su pareja tuvo que encontrar la manera de poder generar el dinero que necesitaba para enfrentar los gastos que requería la educación de sus hijos, durante éste tiempo ha aprendido a conocer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes y es por eso que tiene siempre el diseño o modelo preciso para sus clientes.Le gusta de su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho para conseguir las cosas y gracias a esa perseverancia y empeño puede generar ingresos en su hogar.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo , de la misma manera  se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir conformada por camisas, polos, blusas, pantalones y faldas para continuar vendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milagros, 42, is a single mother of four children, ages 23, 21, 19, and 15.  They still live with her in her own house, which she bought with the fruit of her effort.

Milagros's job is selling clothing.  She does her job in different streets of the city, selling to friends, neighbors, and family members.  She also works on foot in the different markets in the city.  She brings clothes from another city, where she herself goes to select the best-quality clothing in the best designs.

She has been working this way for four years.  She does it alone because when she separated from her husband she had to find a way to earn the income she needed to pay her children's education expenses.  During this time she has learned to recognized the tastes and preferences of her customers, which is why she always has the exact style or model for them.

She likes her job because she has time for other activities.  She knows she has to work very hard to get things and thanks to her perseverance and dedication she can generate an income in her home.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she's grateful to those people who are giving her the loan she needs to increase her working capital.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles [PEN] she'll buy a large quantity of clothing to continue selling to her customers: shirts, polo shirts, blouses, pants, and skirts.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and other clothing

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en: Vangeline is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misanmis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Luchando Todas Juntas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Luchando Todas Juntas esta en su ciclo 16 gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de todas. Ellas se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por medio de ese esfuerzo están ayudando a sus familias. Estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que mostró que ninguna de ellas esta en rojo.
Ursula es parte de este grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas. Cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela porque sus comidas son muy ricas. Ella comenta que siempre vende todo lo que hace y las personas siempre le hacen más pedidos. Ursula es una persona muy trabajadora, que día a día se esfuerza al máximo por tener un mejor estilo de vida, no solo para ella, sino también para su familia.
Ursula solicita de este crédito para comprar verduras, carne, jamón, queso, discos de empanadas, panificados y demás para seguir haciendo las delicias que vende y seguir deleitando a su clientela.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luchando Todas Juntas" (Everyone Striving Together) is in its16th loan cycle, thanks to the members' efforts and sacrifice. They strive to get ahead and help their families. According to the poverty reduction survey they participated in, none of the women were in the red.

Ursula is a member and sells food. She says she has a loyal customer base because her food is delicious. She always sells what she prepares, and people always ask for more. Ursula works very hard every day to have a better life for herself and for her family. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables, beef, ham, cheese, empanadas, bread, and more to keep making delicacies to sell and to delight her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, ham, cheese, empanadas, bread, and more.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es: Neyda, de 31 años, está casada y tiene 02 hijos de 8 años y 10 meses de edad respectivamente, a quienes brinda los cuidados necesarios ya que aún son muy pequeños, vive en la casa de sus suegros.Neyda, durante mucho tiempo trabajo en diversas actividades, pero desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la venta de muebles, se encarga de comprar muebles al por mayor en los distintos talleres de carpintería, los transporta hasta su casa en donde está ubicado su local y se encarga de distribuir los muebles al crédito para luego cobrar de manera semanal o quincenal según las posibilidades del cliente. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad más de 3 años y tiene el respaldo y la ayuda de su esposo ya que juntos iniciaron esta labor que les brinda la posibilidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida .Lo que le gusta de su función es que siente que es muy divertido trabajar a lado de su esposo, además tiene la disponibilidad de usar su tiempo libre para atender a sus hijos,en el negocio le va bien porque vende productos de calidad y ahora es muy solicitada por sus clientes, razón por la cual desea consolidar su negocio y empezar a formar su propio taller de carpintería en donde pueda elaborar los muebles con ayuda de su esposo y otras personas.Este es el crédito número 05 con Kiva, es por eso que agradece este apoyo finaciero que le permite  continuar con su trabajo , además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará algunas herramientas de carpintería como cinceles y pulidoras manuales,tambien comprará de madera para que empiece a fabricar los muebles que pone a la venta.
texts.en: Neyda, aged 31, is married and has 2 children aged 8 years and 10 months respectively, who she looks after carefully as they are still very young. She lives with her parents-in-law. Neyda has been working in a variety of jobs for a long time, but for a while now she has been selling furniture. She buys furniture wholesale at different carpentry workshops, transports them to her house where her shop is located and distributes the furniture on credit which she then collects each week or fortnight depending on her clients' circumstances. She has been working in this way for more than 3 years and she has the support and assistance of her husband as they began this business together as an opportunity for a better quality of life. What she likes about her job is that she finds it fun to work with her husband, and she is also able to use her free time to look after her children. Her business is going well because she sells high-quality products and she is now in demand with her clients. This is why she wants to strengthen her business and begin to create her own carpentry workshop where she can make furniture with the help of her husband and others. This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and that is why she is grateful for this financial support which allows her to continue with her work. She is committed to making her repayments punctually. With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will buy some carpentry tools such as chisels and manual polishers. She will also buy wood in order to start making the furniture which she will later sell.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools and wood for furniture.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Lay is 41 years old and married. She has three children. To support their big family, she and her husband have been farming rice and selling grocery items. The current business earns about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Lay’s group consists of four members who have just joined VisionFund. Lay is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy grocery items for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa  tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de ropa; aprendió el oficio por necesidad de trabajar para los gastos del hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas ropa; para ampliar su mercado y tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Josefa, 54, is married and has two children. She has been selling clothing for 10 years, a business she learned because she needed to work and pay the household expenses. She is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy more clothing to expand her market and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to expand her market and increase her earnings.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José  tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es un hombre emprendedor que detecto la necesidad de instalar un molino en su comunidad, ya que no existía ninguno hace 10 años; también se dedica a cultivar granos básicos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva maíz y maicillo para consumo de su familia y vender a otras personas. Con la inversión, espera asegurar parte del alimentote su familia y tener la posibilidad de vender para obtener un ingreso extra.
texts.en: José, 62, is married and has three children. He is an enterprising man who saw the need to set up a mill in his community, as there was no mill at the time. Ten years ago, he also decided to grow basic grain crops. He will use the loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo to pay the rent on the land where he grows corn and maicillo to feed his family and sell to others. He expects this investment to produce part of his family's food and to create the opportunity to have additional income from selling food to others.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he grows corn and maicillo to feed his family and sell to others.

loans.name: Esterfila Leonor

texts.es:
ESTERFILA LEONOR tiene 48 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

ESTERFILA LEONOR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, fréjol,habas. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguisidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en chimbo. El sueño es incrementar el negocio y la producción en los terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia. En el timepo libre le gusta salir a caminar y disfrutar de la compañía de loa hijos.
texts.en: Esterfila Leonor, 48, is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Chimbo, Bolivar Province. Esterfila Leonor works in agriculture and plants corn, wheat, kidney beans, and broad beans. She is asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, liquid pest killer, manure, fertilizer, fungicides, and pesticides. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for farming. She will make her purchases in Chimbo. Her dream is to expand her business and production on the land. The challenge she faces is improving her family's quality of life. In her free time, she likes to walk and enjoy the company of her children.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, liquid pest killer, manure, fertilizer, fungicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Monther appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Areej is a 32 year old young woman. She is married and a mother to three sons and one daughter.

For the past six months, Areej's husband has been operating a barber shop.  The barber shop is the only one in the area and has good customer flow.  These factors make the shop successful.  

The shop is the family's only source of income and it needs more support to cover some necessary costs. Areej is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new barber kit. The loan will allow Monther to provide better quality service to his loyal customers and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new barber kit

loans.name: Sandra Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Verónica es originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, es madre soltera y tiene una hija adolecente bajo su responsabilidad. Actual mente esta trabajando para una empresa comercial como regenta, es como genera el ingreso para salir adelante con su hija y darle lo mejor y los estudios necesarios para que tenga un mejor futuro.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la colocación de los tubos de agua en el domicilio ya que están en muy malas condiciones. 
Con una parte del sueldo que recibe será para pagar el crédito. Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su hija y que vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Sandra Verónica is originally from Nuevo Laredo, she is a single mother, and has an adolescent daughter in her care. She is currently working for a commercial business as a manager and this is how she is able to make a living and to help her daughter advance in life, giving her all the best as well as the necessary schooling she needs for a better future. She is asking for a loan in order to improve the plumbing in her home as the current pipes are in poor condition. She will repay her loan with a percentage of her paycheck. She wants to improve her daughter's position in life and wants her to be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: change the plumbing in her house.

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales et des fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise en haut  à l’extrême gauche en 1ère position sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes de toutes sortes dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paniers de papayes avec les maraîchers du village. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans la foire de Konodimini  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer. Elle ambitionne faire l’élevage des petits ruminants avec l’épargne constituée avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djiguissèmè group are all married women living mainly in monogamous families. They average 49 years of age, with three children. They all live in the N’gara village in the Sègou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors or relatives, as well as through their commerce. They retail cereals, fruits and vegetables. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are  now on their fourth solidarity loan.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the one seated in the top row on the far left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of fruits and vegetables of all kinds in the N’gara village and the nearby region. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 baskets of papayas from village farmers. She resells for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the Konodimini market, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 17,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for her children’s needs. Her goal is to start raising small livestock thanks to the savings she will be able to grow with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy papayas.

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 48 años, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos uno de los cuales ya es independiente y los otros 2 se encuentran estudiando en una escuela fiscal. Nació en un pueblo de Loja en donde terminó la educación secundaria. No recibió el apoyo de su pareja y quedó solo a cargo de sus hijos a quienes hasta el momento ha logrado sacar adelante gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo. En la actualidad vive con sus hijos en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Luis se dedica a la comercialización de calzado específicamente en zonas rurales. Aprendió de esta actividad de sus familiares y lo emprendió por sí solo desde hace 20 años. Luis requiere un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería y así surtir la oferta para sus clientes. De esta forma los ingresos del negocio crecerán y Luis podrá brindar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida además que podrá destinar parte de sus ganancias a un fondo de ahorro para en un futuro comprar un vehículo que le permita visitar  a sus clientes y recorrer más lugares de su país con sus hijos. Luis motiva a quienes alrededor del mundo financian los sueños de personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras como el, para que sigan creyendo en la gente de “afuera” porque seguramente su apoyo los llevará a crecer como personas. Es su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa y espera seguir trabajando con ellos ya que tiene muy buenas recomendaciones de su hermana que es cliente de allí también.
texts.en:
Luis, 48, is single and has three children, one of whom lives independently and the other two are students. He was born in the town of Loja, where he finished high school. His doesn't receive support from his partner and is solely responsible for his children, for whom he has provided through hard work. In recent years, he has lived with his children in Río Verde de Santo Domingo parish, the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province in Ecuador.
The province has seen sustained growth, and its capital is known for its delicious, colorful fruits and cuisine. There is significant commerce because the area has become a trading center between the country's mountain and coastal areas.There are beautiful sites where the weather is warm that attract both local and foreign tourists. Most of the residents are merchants or service providers to the locals and tourists.

Luis sells shoes, especially in rural areas. He learned the business from relatives and has been working alone for 20 years. He needs a loan to buy merchandise to offer his customers. His earnings will grow, and he will be able to offer his children a better life. He will also save part of his profits so that he one day can buy a vehicle to visit his customers and to see more areas of the country with his children. 

Luis encourages lenders around the world to finance the dreams of hardworking entrepreneurs like himself, so that they keep believing in people far away. Surely, the support of these people will help the borrowers grow as people. This is his first loan cycle with Fundación Alternativa. He expects to keep working with the institution, as his brother is a client and recommends the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for inventory.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is 39 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Rodelia is selling clothes in their public market as a source of income. Her husband is her partner in making their living better. With her determination to achieve her dream, which is providing the best living for her child, Rodelia keeps on her journey in life by selling clothes. She just loves her child so much, so she doesn't want her to suffer. Rodelia’s wish is for continued growth of her business to gain higher income and invest in an additional business as a source of income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more clothes to sell. She hopes to manage her business well and to be able to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 34 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 16 años. Ella para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, desde hace 3 años decidió genera ingresos mediante un negocio, en el cual vende mercancía variada, usando catálogos para promocionar los artículos que ofrece. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito a un grupo de clientes que ha estructurado y que hoy le compran permanentemente. Su sobrina que es líder en la marca de los productos que ella vende, la introdujo en el negocio y ella poco a poco ha logrado posicionarse.   Las compras las realiza cada 21 días, en el mismo momento  en el que   paga sus facturas del mes anterior. En la actualidad requiere tener un efectivo disponible, para aumentar el volumen de sus compras de artículos que tienen descuentos especiales y que ella necesita tener en su estantería para ser más competitiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bisutería, perfumería y cosmético, además de ropa y calzado. Con su inversión de Kiva logrará aumentar su capital y ter un efectivo para responder de manera efectiva a su clientela.
texts.en:
Sonia, 34, lives with her husband and her two children, ages 10 and 16.  Three years ago, to support the well-being of her household, she decided to generate income with a business in which she sells a variety of merchandise, using catalogues to promote the articles she sells.  She sells on credit to a group of customers she has organized who buy from her all the time now.

Her niece is the leader of the brand of products she sells.  She introduced her to the business and little by little she has managed to get a foothold.  She makes her purchases every 21 days, when she pays her bills for the previous month.

Currently she needs to have available cash to increase the volume of purchases of articles with special discounts that she needs to have in stock to be more competitive.  This is why she's asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With her loan she'll buy costume jewelry, perfume, and cosmetics as well as clothing and footwear.  With the investment from Kiva she'll be able to increase her capital and have cash to respond effectively to her customers.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, perfume, cosmetics, clothing, and footwear

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 44 años, esta casada y tiene 6 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo.El trabajo de Lucila consiste en la venta de comida. Tiene su propio local el cual consiguió tras muchos años de esfuerzo. Se inició vendiendo en la vereda de su casa en donde instalaba una mesa, un par de sillas y una modesta cocina desde ahi atendía a sus clientes , actualmente tiene un amplio local con mayor cantidad de mesas y en donde ofrece mayor cantidad de comidas las cuales son propias de la cocina peruana. Anteriormente trabajaba sola, pero ahora trabajaba al lado de 02 personas más. Lleva trabajando en su negocio un promedio de 02 años y está contenta por que le está yendo.
Le gusta su trabajo ya que por las mañanas puede utilizar parte de su tiempo para otras actividades en su hogar y otras funciones que también son necesarias para el funcionamiento de su negocio. Por fortuna tiene clientes todos los días ya que está ubicada en un lugar muy accesible para el público y esto le permite incrementar sus ingresos a diario y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, aún se encuentra en proceso de expansión y de remodelación de su establecimiento y espera culminarlo lo más pronto posible. 
Este es el crédito número 04 con Kiva y está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía de continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará ingredientes para la cocina tales como arroz , carnes , huevos , entre otros , asi como tambien los utensilios que usará en su local.
texts.en:
Lucila is 44 years old, she is married and has six children who all live in her house, along with her husband. Lucila's work consists in selling food items. She has her own storefront that she was able to obtain after many years of hard work. She began selling food on the sidewalk in front of her house, where she set up a table, a couple of chairs and a modest kitchen from which she served her customers. She currently has a larger location with a larger number of tables, where she offers a larger variety of foods in the Peruvian tradition. Before, she was working alone, but now she has two other people working for her. She has been working in this business for 2 years and she is happy with how things are going. 
She likes her work, and in the morning, she uses part of her time to do other things in her house and to take care of other obligations that her business needs to run smoothly. Fortunately, she has customers every day because she is located in a very accessible place and this helps her to grow her earnings on a daily basis and to bring better living conditions to her family. She is even in the process of expanding and remodeling her locale and she hopes to finish the work as soon as possible. 
This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is very happy to know that she has the financial support that will allow her to continue to work with a peace of mind. For her part, she promises to repay her loan on time. With the amount she is asking for, she will purchase ingredients like rice, meats, eggs, among other things, as well as cooking utensils that she will use in her restaurant.

loans.use: purchase ingredients and utensils to cook with.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mahmoud appears in her Kiva profile photo.  He is pictured with the new chairs he wants to purchase.

Fadwa is a 25 year old married young woman. She is a mother to one son and one daughter. Her husband is employed but earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past two years, Fadwa's husband has been purchasing chairs and renting them to customers. This has been a profitable project and provides the family with a second source of income. Fadwa is requesting a $2,500 youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing additional new chairs. This loan will increase the family's income and offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new chairs to rent to customers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is well known as a good citizen in Barangay. She dreams of becoming a successful woman someday. She is 49-years-old, married and has six children. Some of them are still going to school. To fulfill the dreams of her children, Evelyn works hard and patiently in managing her retail business. She has been running her business for almost 12 years. 

Evelyn is asking for a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages, candies and assorted breads to sell. Evelyn hopes that she can obtain the loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, candies and assorted breads to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel, 52, is married and has three children. Anabel dreams of lifting her family from poverty, which is why she works hard in her sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for almost 30 years and usually earns about 500 PHP a day. At this time, Anabel is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, beverages and condiments to sell in her sari-sari store. Anabel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads, beverages and condiments to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 43, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, a vendor and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Evangeline operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Evangeline dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like men's and women's clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar, 37 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Last year in July, he began building his own house and in October, the family moved to their newly built house. His wife has a position of teacher at high school and recently has taken her maternity leave. He, together with his colleagues, has been making interior decoration work to local customers since 2009. 

The family purchases water at a high price due to their house not being connected with the central sewer (water) system and burn lot of coal in order to warm up cold water for shower and consumption. So he is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to connect his house to the central sewer (water) system. As a result, the family will have access to clean drinking water. More importantly, the family won't need to burn coal in order to warm up cold water thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution and energy efficiency. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to connect his house to central sewer (water) system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She previously received a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to grow and become successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business

loans.name: 3.10.261.3.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng is the group leader of the 3.10.261.3.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

Hằng has a retail business farming poultry and cattle. Hằng has been involved in this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hằng hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

Hằng is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hằng supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.12.263.15.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

In 2010, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu is the group leader of the 3.12.263.15.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.

Thu is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children. Her children are grown up so Thu supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan y su esposa la señora Janet Patricia son originarios de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene elaborando desde hace mas de 2 años en una bodega en la vecina ciudad de Laredo Texas y la señora Janet Patricia trabaja en limpieza en casa particulares, con estos ingresos que obtienen han podido darles el estudia necesario a sus dos hijos, uno estudia la secundaria y otro la preparatoria.
Están solicitando un préstamo para terminar los cuartos de la planta alta de su casa ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio y un lugar mas adecuado para estudiar. 
Con el sueldo que recibe el señor Juan es para pagar el préstamo, con el ingreso de la señora Janet Patricia es para los gastos familiares y escolares.
El señor Juan y su esposa desean mejorar el patrimonio de sus hijos y que este en mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Juan and his spouse Janet Patricia are from the city of Nuevo Laredo. Juan has been working for more than two years in a store in the neighbouring city of Laredo, Texas. Janet Patricia works cleaning private homes. With the income that they earn they have been able to provide the necessary education for their two children, one of whom is in junior high school and the other is in secondary school.

They are asking for a loan to finish the rooms on the top floor of their house. Now that their children are growing up, they need their own space and a better place to study.

With the salary he receives Juan will pay for the loan, and Janet Patricia's income is to pay family and schooling expenses. Juan and his wife wish to improve the inheritance that they'll leave for their children and give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish rooms of the top floor of his home.

loans.name: Ravdanbat

texts.en: Mr. Ravdanbat, 31 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a fenced in land. He and his wife have been doing building decoration work through contracts with building companies since 2003. His three children all go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to cover the costs of purchasing building materials such as bricks, cement and metals as well as installing a heating system. During this period of time, the prices of building materials have reached their lowest rate and purchasing them now will save him a lot of money. More importantly, installing a heating system into the house will enable the family to live in a comfortable and warm place. As a direct consequence of a warm house the family will burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to install a heating system into house

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga, 40 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on fenced land. His wife has been working as an auditor at a private business entity. He himself has been working as a serviceman for five years.  

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair, so he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as wallpaper, paints, fiberglass and foams. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, due to the renovated and insulated house, the family will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 44 years old. He is married and has four children, aged 8, 12, 16, and 18. Three of his children attend school. 

In 1998, Ibrahim established his used clothing (house dressings) business. He began his business because he was in school when his father died. As a result, he went to live with his older sister and joined his brother-in-law's business.  Ibrahim stayed with them for several years before he set up his own business.  

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, Ibrahim earns about SLL 775,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to purchase five bales of house dressings. In the future, Ibrahim plans to improve his business and educate his school-going children. He wants to acquire more loans in order to purchase large amounts of stock.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of used clothing (house dressings)

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen  tiene 60 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposo  tiene 9 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Carmen se  dedica al negocio de cacao y banana la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, café.  Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción. La compra los realiza quincenalmente en Ventanas.  El sueño es trabajar mucho para solventar las necesidades de la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es salir adelante en la meta que me proponga. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta coser y disfrutar de las festividades.
texts.en:
Carmen is 60 years old, in a common-law relationship with her husband, and has nine children. She lives in the city of Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province.

The February 25th Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Guabito in Zapatol Parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm laborers.

Carmen has a cacao and banana business, but she also grows corn, cacao, and coffee. In addition to this, she raises animals such as chickens and pigs. Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, liquid weed killers, and insecticides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for farming so that she will have a good production. Her purchases are conducted in Ventanas every 15 days. Her dream is to work hard so that she can provide for the needs of her family. Her challenges include moving ahead with the goals that she has set for herself.

In her free time, Carmen enjoys sewing and experiencing the local festivities.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Blanca Ofelia

texts.es:
El señora, Blanca Ofelia,   es una persona trabajadora, labora diario desde muy temprano hasta la tarde, los  siete días de la semana en su domicilio, su negocio venta de carbón y frijoles por saco, ella brinda atención  a sus clientes. 

Trabaja junto a su esposo quien le sale a vender de forma ambulante. También  se dedican a la agricultura como siembra de frijoles y maíz.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de carbón. Esto con el propósito de  tener mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes Y captar más compradores de sus productos. En el crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más carbón y mejora en su vivienda. 

 Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos ha incrementado su negocio y  le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Ofelia is a hardworking woman who works every day of the week from very early until the afternoon.  Her business is selling charcoal and sacks of beans.  She serves her customers at home.

She works with her husband, who goes out on foot to sell for her.  They also make a living in agriculture growing beans and corn.

She's requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to invest in working capital to buy charcoal.  This is so she has a greater quantity to satisfy customer demand and attract more buyers of her products.  She used the previous loan to buy more charcoal and to improve her house.

She's grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for the opportunity and the trust they have placed in her.  With the loans she has increased her business, allowing her to bring food home and have better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Reina, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a una hija menor de edad y dos nietas. Ella tiene su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace 12 años, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser refrescos, pan, tortillas, carne de pollo, manteca, huevos etc. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 21,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio, va comprar azúcar, frijoles, maíz, jabón y tarjetas para celulares. Tiene como plan seguir con la pulpería y convertirla en un minisúper y poder darle el estudio universitario a su hija.
texts.en:
Reina is 61 years old and a single mother. She lives in a suburban neighbourhood of San Pedro Sula with a daughter, who is a minor, and two granddaughters. She has had her own grocery store for 12 years, where she sells basic food products like soft drinks, bread, tortillas, chicken, butter, eggs, etc. 

She decided to apply for a loan of 21,000 lempiras to stock her business. She will buy sugar, beans, corn, soap and pre-paid cell phone cards. Her plan is to continue with the grocery store and convert it into a convenience store, as well as to be able to send her daughter to university.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, corn, beans, and pre-paid cell phone cards, to stock her business.

loans.name: Lucia Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia vive en La Libertad. Ella tiene 37 años de edad. La clienta nos cuenta que ella empezó a vender cosméticos, y como le fue bien decidió ampliar su negocio de productos.

Ella realiza su trabajo de lunes a domingos en el mercado de la ciudad.Su trabajo es de ventas de cosméticos.

La clienta está casada, y su esposo es taxista. Ella tiene 3 hijos todos menores de edad y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo ella desea comprar productos como: perfumes, cremas, visuterias.etc Su sueño para un futuro seria de tener su local propio en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia, age 37, lives in Libertad. She says that she began selling cosmetics and did very well. Now she wants to expand her inventory of products.

Lucia works Monday through Sunday at the city market. Her work involves selling cosmetics. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. Lucia has three young children who all attend a state school.

With this loan, she will buy products such as perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and other items. Her dream for the future is to have her own shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and other items.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
This is Melchora, a 51-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Johnny and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melchora buys general merchandise from wholesalers, selling it at a small profit. Her products are children and women’s clothes and the like. Her customers, consisting of neighbors and the local community, are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help Melchora continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items such as women and children's wear to expand her product inventory.

Melchora hopes for continued business success and dreams of having a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise such as women and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 44 years old and is widowed. Nida has three children. She supports her children by doing something that brings her income. Right now, Nida is engaged in the fish selling business. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns about PHP 500 each day. At this time, Nida is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: 3.13.264.09. Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell.  Hồng is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Hồng is the group leader of the 3.13.264.09. Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to resell

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been in this business for almost two years. Right now, Lovelyn is 26 years old and happily married to Danilo. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with three children.

To this end, Lovelyn is asking for a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy more products such as perfume, blouses, lotion and shoes to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more products such as perfume, blouses, lotion and shoes to sell

loans.name: Young's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Young is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Cassava planting and rice farming have been the main sources of her family’s income for 25 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns her about 14,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Young’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is the first microloan for her with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies for her family’s consumption. She hopes for a timely harvest of her cassava and rice and she hopes to have enough household supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: José Gabriel

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos (tres mujeres y dos hombres), todos mayores de edad. Desde la edad de los diez años, él a trabajado en la agricultura sembrando maíz, fríjol y maicillo, su padre fue quien le enseño y este a su vez le ha enseñado a sus dos hijos varones. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, teja y adobe para construir su casa; debido a que la casa en la que están viviendo no reúne las condiciones apropiadas para vivir, pues esta construida de lamina y sácate.  Él desea proporcionara su familia una vivienda digna y continuar trabajando en la agricultura para obtener el alimento que necesita su familia y que ellos se sientan orgullosos de él.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old, married, and has five children (three daughters and two sons). All of his children are grown. Since the age of 10, José has worked in the agricultural trade, growing corn, beans, and sorghum. His father was the one who taught him this trade and now José is passing his knowledge on to his two sons.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood, tiles, and adobe so that he can build his house. The house where he is currently resides does not have appropriate living conditions since it is built from laminate and scrap material. José wants to provide a decent home for his family. He also wants to continue working in agriculture so that he can provide the food that his family needs. Accomplishing these two feats would make him feel proud.

loans.use: to buy wood, tiles, and adobe for building his house.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 36 years old and is married to Julio. She lives with her family in the village of Estrella. She has two school-aged children. To generate income, she is engaged in a retail business. She has been running her business for more than five years. 

At this moment, Lenie is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and beverages. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, condiments and beverages.

loans.name: 3.1.265.01.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Thanh is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Thanh is the group leader of the 3.1.265.01.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  Thanh supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 52 years old, married and had two children. She sells grocery items to the people in her village and earns 5,000 PHP each month. It goes for meals and revolving capital in the business.

She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to invest in her store and buy more merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, breads, biscuits and soap to sell.

In the future, Soledad hopes to keep offering affordable and high quality goods to attain more profits for the development of her business and to their lives as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 43 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 13 años quien es la razón de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que de ella depende su educación y su alimentación, tiene su casa propia en donde vive junto a su padre y su hijo.Olga se dedica a la venta de yuca pero su principal ingreso económico radica en la venta de la harina de yuca ya que es un producto muy consumido en la región. Algunas veces recibe pedidos de otras ciudades hasta donde transporta toda su mercadería en sacos de 50 kilos cada uno. Lleva trabajando por más de 07 años en esta actividad, lo hace sola y como tiene experiencia en el negocio siempre obtiene buenos ingresos económicos.
