She will buy soft drinks, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help her improve her income and meet the demands of customers who come to buy merchandise from her store. 

In the future, Dahlia hopes to keep improving sales and to earn money to save and use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme assise  en haut sur la photo à l’extrême droite) est une grande vendeuse de riz dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz avec les exploitants à la foire de Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans la foire de Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Korotoumou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the "Tièssiri" group are married and live mostly in polygamous households. They are on average 46 years old with five children. They all live in the town of N'gara in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood and family connections as well as through the businesses they run in the town. They sell cereals, fruits, and vegetables. With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eighth solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Korotoumou (the woman sitting in the second row all the way on the right in the photo) is a major rice seller in the town of N'gara and its surroundings. She intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of rice from the farmers at the market fair in Konodimini. She resells the rice in cash and on credit at her home and at the market in Konodimini to a clientele composed mainly of women. Ms. Korotoumou hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for the children in her household.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Windingoudi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZALISSA est la représentante du groupe WINDIN GOUDI. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que sa famille.  Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est couturière. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 16ans.Mme vend aussi des bijoux et du savon. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Toecin et Bissighin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut  s’acheter 05 rouleaux de popeline, 02 paquets  de fermeture, des bijoux et 03cartons de savons.
 Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Mme ambitionne  acheter une machine à broder pour son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Zalissa is the leader of the "Windin Goudi" group. She and her family are both doing very well. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 11 and the youngest is 5. All three attend school, and Ms. Zalissa has three people in her care.
Ms. Zalissa is a dressmaker. She has run this business for 16 years. She also sells jewelry and soap. She gets her supplies at the Toecin and Bissighin markets. Her customers are men and women.
Ms. Zalissa wants to buy five rolls of poplin, two packets of clasps, jewelry, and three boxes of soap.
She wants to save her profits and improve her own and her family's living conditions. Her ambition is to buy an embroidery machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy five rolls of poplin, two packets of clasps, jewerlry, and three boxes of soap.

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 32 ans, Madame Assétou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et ses enfants à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso     ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assétou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des spaghettis depuis plus de deux ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux  ans, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel et les trois prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce 4ème prêt,  60 cartons de spaghettis de qualités différentes auprès des grossistes. Elle a une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes et elle vend en détail et au comptant.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Assétou is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in a large traditional extended household with her husband and children in Kaboïla II, one of the populous areas of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
After having run several businesses without success, Ms. Assétou began buying and selling spaghetti over two years ago. She runs her business at her home. She is highly sought-after by her clientele for the quality of her products. To satisfy her increasingly growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago, and she is on her fourth individual loan, with the three previous loans having been repaid properly.
With this fourth loan, she intends to buy 60 boxes of spaghetti of varying kinds from the wholesalers. She has a clientele composed essentially of women, and she sells at retail in cash.
With this loan, she foresees realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to household expenses, pay off the interest on her loan, and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy spaghetti.

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme DELPHINE est la représentante du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE . ODETTE se porte bien mais cède sa place à DELPHINE.  DELPHINE est aussi mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Elle est prépare et vend aussi du dolo  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Bendatoega. Ses clients sont les femmes et les  hommes.
Elle veut  s’acheter  02sacs de sorgho rouge et 03 charrettes de bois pour la préparation de son dolo.
Mme épargne et améliore les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne augmenter sa production et acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Ms. Delphine is the leader of the "Saint Jean Baptiste" group. Odette is doing well, but has given over her position to Delphine. Delphine is also married and has four children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 5. Three of her children attend school.
She has prepared and sold dolo (millet beer) for eight years. She gets her supplies at the Bendatoega market. Her customers are women and men. 
She wants to buy two sacks of red sorghum and three cartloads of wood to prepare her dolo.
Ms. Delphine saves her profits and improves her family's living conditions with them. Her ambition is to increase her production and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of red sorghum and three cartloads of wood to prepare dolo (millet beer).

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle  Ami est née en 1983 à Sikasso et est mère d’une petite fille. Elle réside chez ses grands parents maternels à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Mademoiselle  Ami n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, alors elle s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis environ onze années. Avec une telle expérience dans un domaine, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par des jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, anniversaire, etc.). En plus de la coiffure Ami fait également l’achat vente des robes de mariés, des mèches des gels etc.  L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans et a bénéficié  de quatre prêts qui ont été très bien remboursé. Elle sollicite ainsi ce cinquième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter 4 robes de marié et 15 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice moyen 110 000 FCFA lui permettant de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Ami was born in 1983 in Sikasso and has one young daughter. She lives at her maternal grandparents' home in Sanoubougou II, one of the populous areas in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Ms. Ami did not have the opportunity to continue her education, so she quickly began training as a women's hairstylist about eleven years ago. With this experience in her field, she is highly sought-after by young women, especially for big ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, birthdays, etc.). In addition to her hairstylist work, Ami also buys and sells wedding dresses, hair extensions, hair gels, etc. Combating the insufficiency of her own resources to run this activity properly constitutes the goal and the reason for this loan request to Soro Yiriwaso to better satisfy the needs of increasingly growing clientele.
She has worked with Soro Yiriwaso for over three years and has benefited from four loans, which were all repaid very well. She is thus seeking this fifth loan to increase her working capital in order to be able to buy four wedding dresses and 15 packets of hair extensions of varying kinds in Bamako.
With this loan, she foresees realizing an average profit of 110,000 FCFA, which will allow her to contribute to the household expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses and hair extensions.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia generates income by selling grocery items to the people in her village. Ofelia is 58 years old and a widow. She carries the burden alone in sustaining the needs of her family. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy items to resell in her store, like soft drinks, eggs, bread, noodles and soap. This will help increase her sales capacity. 

Ofelia hopes to keep increasing her sales and developing her business, to achieve income stability someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, noodles and soap, to sell in her store

loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Agé de plus 46 ans, Monsieur Almoudou  est marié et père de 4 filles, il réside avec sa famille à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Almoudou n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école,  s’est très vite initié depuis plus de trente années à la couture auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atelier se situe au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu la présidence du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) et des tissus pour homme afin de les revendre aux tailleurs de Sikasso. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est en partenariat il y environ quatre années. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter 15 machines à coudre et accessoires et 30 complets tissus.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Almoudou is over 46 years old.  He is married and the father of four daughters.  He lives with his family in Médine, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Almoudou did not have the opportunity to progress far in his studies.  Instead, he quickly learned to sew from his uncle, in Sikasso.  He has now been working as a tailor for more than 30 years.  His shop is located at the Grand Market in Sikasso, and most of his customers are male stallholders.  Thanks to his vast experience in his field of work, he is held in high esteem by other tailors and he is the president of the Supervisory Committee of the A.T.S. (Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso), the Sikasso Tailors' Association.  

In addition to his job as a tailor, Almoudou also buys sewing machines in Lomé (republic of Togo), as well as fabrics for men, which he resells to other tailors in Sikasso.

Eager to meet the increasing number of orders he receives, he is requesting this fourth loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which he has collaborated for about four years.

This new loan will allow him to buy 15 sewing machines and accessories and 30 pieces of fabrics, each measuring 1 x 3 meters.

Thanks to this loan, Almoudou is expecting monthly profits to reach 300,000 CFA francs, which will help him to cover most of his personal expenses, to contribute to his family's expenses and pay off his loan's interest.  He will reinvest the rest of his money in his shop.

loans.use: to buy some sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en: Isabelita is 59 years old, married, and has six children. To generate income, Isabelita engages in a direct-selling business. She has been in this business for three years, earning about PHP 1,000 a week. Isabelita needs additional capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase blouses, pants, perfumes, powders and lotions, to offer for sale in her village. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, perfumes, powders and lotions, to offer to her customers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of spices and vegetables to sell.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nabweru Development Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old, a resident of Nabweru, and a member of Nabweru Development Group. She is married and has four children, who all attend school. Despite the fact that she earns little income, Ruth also takes care of her brother’s children, because he passed away two years back.

Ruth started up a small retail shop next to her home, when her husband had lost his job after a long period of illness. Ruth has been able to support her family without the help of her husband, providing all the necessary needs. She provides good customer care and this has led to the growth of her business.

Ruth needs a loan for completion of her water tank. Because there is scarcity of clean water in her home area, without a water tank her children have been required to walk long distances in search of clean water, something that is risky and not healthy at their tender ages. This was necessary, because Ruth, the mother, has to keep at her business and do all the housework. She hopes with the completion of the tank, her worries over luck of finding water, and the suffering borne by the children in search for water over long distances, will be over. Ruth is hard-working, honest and sociable. Ruth is the one pictured in a black ring.

loans.use: to complete installation of a water tank for her family

loans.name: Memia

texts.en: Memia is engaged in a direct-sales business. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She would like to increase her stock of shoes, blouses, and cosmetics because she has many orders that she has been unable to fulfill due to insufficient funds. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She knows that with this loan she can satisfy her customers and make sure she has the requested products. This loan will be used to buy stock of blouses, cosmetic products, and shoes for her direct-selling business. Memia hopes and prays that her loan will be granted and she is able to get ahead in life and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy stock of blouses, cosmetic products, and shoes.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 52 years old, married and lives in Sampaguita.  To make a living, Mila operates a store selling grocery items to the people in her village.  She also sells livestock feed as additional income.  Her spouse is her partner in managing the business.  She hopes to keep increasing sales and wants to buy more merchandise.  A loan of P50,000 will help supplement her funds to buy eggs, breads, noodles and livestock feed to sell. 

With determination and patience, Mila will achieve more profit and a progressive life for her family someday.

loans.use: to buy eggs, breads, noodles and livestock feed to sell

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita has run a general store for 21 years. Aside from the retail business, she is also involved in the hog-raising and farming business. Crestita's husband is a barangay (local) official and a farmer.

Crestita would like to increase the volume of her stock merchandise in order to gain greater income and improve her way of life. In order to achieve this, she is asking for a loan of 13,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). She hopes that her retail store will grow smoothly so she can make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise such as soft drinks, sugar, coffee, sacks of rice, and other ingredients to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Naveed Ahmed

texts.en: Mr. Naveed Ahmed is a 36 year old man with 7 years of diverse business experience in sewing and embroidery materials.  He is the sole supporter of his family which includes two children and a housewife. He has requested a loan for Rs 100000. This loan would help him to buy new sewing machines, colored thread, variety of clothes and needles that will increase his production.   His current challenge is the location of his shop, which does not allow easy customer access.  With the help of this loan, his monthly income and savings will increase and he will be able to better educate his children and improve the lifestyle of his family.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines,colored thread, variety of clothes and needles to sell.

loans.name: Baiseta

texts.en:
Baiseta is 46 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Baiseta is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Baiseta requested a PHP 13000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Baiseta has been in pig fattening business for 10 years, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain her business.

Baiseta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en: Ederlina is now 54 years old and has four grown-up children.  She and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community.  They aim to become successful someday in order to give their children a better living.  Ederlina hopes to improve her small eatery in order to increase her income with the help of additional capital.   She is asking for an additional of P9,000.00 to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, pork, chicken, fish, seasonings and grocery items to be cooked and sold at her eatery.  She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, pork, chicken, fish, seasonings and grocery items

loans.name: Wajid Hameed

texts.en:
Wajid Hameed is a 39-year-old businessman, who has 12 years of experience in selling goods. He has two children and a wife. He is the sole supporter of his family. Currently he is trading some household items, like washing powder and soaps, which are used in every home. But, due to lack of a proper display space and shop, he works from his home. Because his selling is home-based, he doesn't have enough customers. 

Now he has requested a loan amount of PKR 120,000 in order to purchase a shop, so he can start a proper retail business.  With the help of this loan amount, he will buy cartons of soap and washing powder at wholesale price, which would be less costly. With the first profit, he is planning to introduce new products, like rice and various food items, in his shop. By doing this he will make his business profitable, which would be beneficial for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To open up a new retail shop.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Maria Fe requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy more fish to resell in her fish stall.

She would like to save enough money to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: anne est une camerounaise de 33 ans, marié et mère de 3 enfants, tous vont à l'école. elle gère un mini restaurant dans un quartier de la depuis 4 ans où elle y prépare et vend de la braise (poisson, poulet) avec compliment (manioc,..).ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant du poisson en grande quantité pour diminuer son coût de transport et augmenter ses profits.les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre de recapitaliser son activité (expansion etc) d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, logement, santé)
texts.en:
Anne is a 33-year-old woman from Cameroon.  She is married and the mother of three children who all attend school.  

For the past four years, she has been managing a mini-restaurant in one of her city's neighborhoods.  She prepares and sells braised fish and chicken, served with cassava.  

This loan will allow her to boost her stock of supplies, since she plans to use it to buy large quantities of fish.  Her goal is to lower her transportation costs and increase her profits.

Anne will use her profits in part to recapitalize and expand her activity and also to meet her family's needs (education, nutrition, housing and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy food supplies (fish).

loans.name: Walter Eduardo

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Walter no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Walter trabaja en el rubro de construcción como ayudante de obras, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de concreto de una habitación de su hogar, la cual está deteriorada, de esta manera Walter podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Walter is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic individual who has the drive to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to find work, Walter was not able to study for a professional degree in Civil Engineering as he would have liked. In his free time, he enjoys watching television and on a few occasions he will prepare a delicious dish of “frejoles con seco” (beans with stewed meat) to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Walter works in the construction trade as an assistant. He works every day for approximately 12 hours. Walter believes he is doing well because he has developed in this trade and treats all of his clients in a friendly manner.

Walter is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will able to make improvements to his home. He wants to plaster and paint the walls as well as install a concrete floor in one of the rooms in his house that has deteriorated. By making these improvements, Walter will be able to provide greater security and well-being for his family. He will continue working and striving to fulfill his greatest wish of studying for a professional degree. Over time, he wants to get ahead.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Riffat Sultana

texts.en:
Riffat Sultana is a 55-year-old, and is the sole supporter of her family, as her husband has divorced her. She now has to face all the challenges of life alone. She has 20 years of extensive experience in the garment business. She has requested a loan of 120,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) from BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use the financing in order to purchase products for her shop, including t-shirts, pants, and some embroidery materials for making embroidered shirts to sell. 

With the help of the additional profits, she wants to establish a garment shop in the main market. This will help her to increase her customers. She desires to save money for her daughter's marriage and to support her elder son in his business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, pants, and some embroidery materials for making embroidered shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for boutique business.

loans.name: Al-Frah Group

texts.en:
Al-Frah group consists of four women from Hadramout, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Farha is a 45-year-old, married woman. She only can read and write. Her husband is very hard-working and doing his best to earn money. However, he is unable to buy a refrigerator for their small house, because what he earns is hardly enough to buy food and pay the rent for the house. Farha decided to help her husband, so she applied for a 30,000 YER loan to buy a refrigerator. She hopes that their living conditions will improve and that they will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her family

loans.name: Shoaib

texts.en:
Mr. Shoaib is a very hardworking man with 8 years of diverse experience in the garments business.  He lives in Lahore, Pakistan.
He has requested a loan for Rs 100000.  With the loan amount he will purchase new dresses, pants, jeans and t-shirts to sell.  This will help him to increase his net sales and income.

With the help of the profits he will be able to better support his family.  He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new dresses, pants, jeans and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 43 years old, married with four children.  She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines.  Encarnacion has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from operating a general store.  Encarnacion is borrowing PHP 25000, through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase materials for fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en: Mr.Naeem is a 27 year old man with 4 years of diverse experience in the tailoring business.  He is the sole supporter of his family which includes three daughters and two sons, all are studying in schools.  He has requested a loan for Rs 120,000 through BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will be very useful for him as he can buy new sewing machines, threads, clothes and needles, that will increase his production.  Ultimately his monthly income and savings will be increased and he will be able to better educate his children and buy a new house for his family.  In future he also plans to open a garment shop since he has extensive experience in clothing.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines, threads, clothes and needles for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 62 years old, married with four children. Ignacia works very hard to provide for them.

Ignacia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF, to buy canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.  Ignacia has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items at her store.

Ignacia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 41 year old married woman and a mother of four children.  She earns a living through her sari-sari store, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Her husband works as a farmer.
Lisa is asking for a loan to buy canned goods candy, soda, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries to sell at her store.  With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.  In the future, Lisa hopes of making her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods candy, soda, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for sweetmeat selling business

loans.name: Djata

texts.fr:
Agée de 30 ans, Madame Djata est mariée et réside dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et une fille à Banconi, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Djata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente d'anacarde  afin d’en faire des noix d’anacarde elle a appris avec une voisine. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits qui sont achetés en gros pour être revendus en détail. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 10 sacs d’anacarde afin de les transformés pour donner des noix d’anacarde de bonne qualité. Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djata, aged 30, is married and lives in Banconi, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).  Her nuclear family consists of herself, her husband and a daughter.

After being involved in many unsuccessful activities, Djata learned from a neighbor how to buy and sell cashew fruits in order to extract cashew nuts. 

Djata works from home.  Her products are in high demand because of their high quality. She buys her merchandise in bulk quantities and resells to a retail customer base.  In order to satisfy the needs of an increasing number of customers, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is taking her second individual loan.

Djata is planning to use her loan to buy 10 bags of cashew fruits from which she will extract good quality cashew nuts.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 90,000 CFA francs, which will be used to contribute to the family's expenses and to pay off her loan's interest.  The rest of the money will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy cashew fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Esta actividad la aprendió de su cuñada quien es confeccionista hace ya 10 años, Actualmente ella y su cuñada trabajan juntas. Ella se dedica a confeccionista. Ella no tiene horario de trabajo.

La única dificultad  que se le presenta en su negocio, es la enfermedad de su hijo, que padece de AUTISMO lo cual le ocupa buena parte del tiempo realizando el tratamiento del hijo.

Ella si está casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y gana el sueldo básico lo cual ya es una aportación para el hogar. Tiene dos niños en escuela fiscal, aunque aspira tener a su niño especial en una escuela particular.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar telas e hilos para su negocio. Sus sueños en lo familiar es poder tener salud y que tenga una mejor preparación sus hijos, poder tener un bazar grande y un carro para el uso de la familia.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil. Ten years ago, she learned how to sew from her sister-in-law who is a seamstress. They now work together. In her work as a seamstress, the borrower does not have a set schedule.

Her only difficulty related to her business is being able to deal with her son’s illness. Her son is autistic, so most of her time is spent administering his treatment. The borrower is married and her husband works for a private company. He earns a basic salary, which is set aside for the household expenses. They have two children in a state school, but she would like to have her son with special needs attend a private school.

With this loan, the borrower will buy fabrics and thread for her business. Her dreams for her family are for them to be healthy and for her children to have the best preparation. She would also like to open a large bazaar and acquire a car that her family can use.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Javier no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Javier trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar por sacos, menestras y otros, de esta manera Javier tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Javier, 20, is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He is a person who is kind, enthusiastic, and hardworking, and he has a strong desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work to help his parents, Javier has not been able to study for a degree in engineering systems, but he dreams of being able to do this.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends, and at times he cooks the rich "lomo saltado" dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Javier has a small grocery store business.  He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that it is going well because of his good prices and the friendly service he provides to his customers.

Javier is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise, such as candy, drinks, rice, sacks of sugar, beans, and other products.  In this way, Javier will be able to have a store that is better stocked with merchandise and will be able to serve more customers, so that he can continue to work and strive to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Alexander Joseth

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo Alexander pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alexander trabaja en su pequeño taller de mecánica, brindando servicios de refacción de autos, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena labor y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Alexander se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir el techo de su vivienda con materiales resistentes y adecuados, ya que actualmente el techo es de esteras, plásticos y al acercarse la época de lluvias, desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran taller mecánico y automotriz.
texts.en:
Alexander, 20, is single and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to excel.  Thanks to his efforts, Alexander was able to study to become a mechanic.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer, and at times he cooks the rich "Arroz con Pollo" (chicken and rice) dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with a lot of work and dedication, Alexander started his own mechanics workshop, where he provides auto repair services.  He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that the business is doing well because of the good work that he does, and because of the friendly service he provides to his customers.

Alexander is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing, he will be able to make some improvements to his home.  He wants to rebuild the roof of his house with materials that are more water resistant and durable, because the current roof is made from woven straw and plastic.  When the rainy season comes, he wants to provide better security and well-being for his family.  He plans to continue to work and exert himself so that he can achieve his greatest dream: to have a big automotive repair shop.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his home

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of four children. They live in Jagna, Bohol. She has been engaged in vegetable farming together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farming business and augment their yield from it. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of their children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Hola  desde Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 10  mujeres  responsables y emprendedoras. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “los Ángeles de Vitarte” una de ellas es la Sra. Reina de 41 años casada y con 3 hijos, la Sra.Reina  se dedica ya hace 5 años a la venta de zapatos   en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. reina  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y salir adelante con sus hijos. su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por lo cual  la Sra. Reina  trabaja mucho. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más zapatos para su posterior venta y así poder tener más ingresos económicos .la Sra reina se despide con un fuerte abraso para  Kiva y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru.

A group of 10 responsible and enterprising women make up the Communal Bank “Los Ángeles de Vitarte”. One of these women is Sra. Reyna. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. For the past five years, she has been selling shoes from the small shop where she works every day. This enables her to move forward and pay for the educational expenses of her children.

Through her efforts, Sra. Reyna has been able to make improvements to her home and help her children get ahead. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. For this reason, Sra. Reyna works hard. The loan she received will be invested in the purchase of more shoes that she will eventually resell. As a result, she will have more income.

Sra. Reyna would like to give a big hug to Kiva and express her appreciation for the loan that has been given to her. This makes it possible for her and her family to make progress.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and has two children. Rosemarie is married and has one child who is in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been in pig fattening business for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past year, Salman has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. The store has been a profitable project.

Salman is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as canned food, rice and dairy products. This will increase sales and improve Salman's income.

Salman is shown photographed in his store.

loans.use: To buy needed stock of basic groceries

loans.name: David Efrain

texts.es:
El Sr. David vive en Guayaquil, tiene 41 años de edad. El empezó trabajando en un taxi cuando se quedo desempleado, debido a esto decidió adquirir un negocio propio por lo que se compró un auto. Esta labor la realiza solo a diario desde las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche en su auto.

Teme a la delincuencia ya que los ladrones que se suben al taxi abundan y las zonas en donde trabaja son lugares muy peligrosos. Está casado su esposa le ayuda trabajando en una empresa, tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

Lo que el cliente mas desea es que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios y que no les haga falta nada. Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas y para reparacion de carros. En el futuro quiere superarse y así poder adquirir un taxi amarillo ya que ahora tiene un taxi informal para tener incrementos sus ingresos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sr. David is 41 years old and lives in Guayaquil. He started working as a taxi driver when he lost his job. When he decided to start his own business, he purchased an automobile. He works by himself every day from 5:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M.

David worries about the rampant crime since thieves can board his taxi whenever he drives through the most dangerous areas. He is married and his wife helps since she works for a company. They have two children who attend a state school.

David greatly wants his children to move ahead with their studies, so he sees to it that they lack nothing. With this loan, he will buy tires and pay for auto repairs. In the future, he wants to be successful and acquire a yellow cab. For now he has an informal taxi, so he would like to increase his earnings in the future.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for auto repairs.

loans.name: Kalangala Group

texts.en:
The Kalangala Group is located in the rural area of Kalangala. The major business of these group members is barkcloth making (a fiber made from trees) and farming. This is their second loan cycle.

Juliet, a 26-year-old, is married with four children aged from 2 to 8 years, of whom two go to school. She is a barkcloth maker. She works for six days a week and 12 hours a day. Her other sources of income are farming and pig rearing. She started the barkcloth business in 2005 with an aim of expanding her income base so that she could be able to get school fees for her children.

Her clients are mainly traders. She will use the loan to boost her barkcloth business by increasing the labor force. By doing this, she will be able to fulfill her dreams of supplying on a large scale and therefore, meet the needs of the customers. She describes herself as a hardworking and honest person. She thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for bringing them to the path of achieving their dreams.

loans.use: To hire labor and buy materials for making barkcloth (a fiber made from trees).

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Through patience and hard work, Rosemarie believes that she will achieve her goals in the future. She is 43 years old and has three school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to improve her variety store in order to increase her income and continuously support the education of her children. Due to financial constraints, she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy flour, rice, sugar, oils, beverages, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that someday, she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, oils, beverages, canned goods, noodles, snack foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 43 años es un hombre responsable y vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en la casa que le ofrecierón los miembros de su comunidad hace 15 años , actualmente tiene grandes hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas en la zona alta de su localidad, ahí todos los días desde los primeros rayos de sol hasta el anochecer trabaja sin descanso para mejorar sus cultivos, comenta que le gusta mucho cuidarlos ya que depende de eso el éxito que obtenga en la cosecha. Sus principales cultivos constan de alverja y maíz, ya que tiene mejores resultados, “mis alimentos son regados por el manantial de la zona, pues mis terrenos se ubican en lo más alto del pueblo”, afirma. Ahora desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos pues quiere elevar el precio de sus cosechas, sabe que lo logrará ya que ahorra en el arado de la tierra, pues posee 2 toros y espera invertir ese dinero en el mejoramiento de sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas .Luis, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Luis, age 43, is a responsible man who lives with his three children. They reside in a house that was offered to them 15 years ago by members of the community. Luis currently has large plots of farmland in the upper district of his town. There he works every day from the first rays of sunlight and continues tirelessly so that he can improve his crops. Luis says he greatly enjoys taking care of his crops because his success is dependent on the harvest. His main crops consist of peas and corn, which have yielded good results. “My crops are watered by the local spring since my land is located in the higher part of town,” Luis confirms.

He now wants to continue improving his crops so that he can get a higher price at harvest. Luis knows how to achieve this goal. He owns two bulls, so he can save on the cost of plowing and invest the money toward improving his crops. This is his first Kiva loan, so Luis promises to be punctual with his payments. He will invest 1,000 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer so that he can nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilmer Patricio

texts.es:
El Señor Wilmer vive en Guayaquil. El nos comento que empezó con esta actividad de mecanico hace 12 años atrás, El escogió esta labor porque se graduó en un colegio técnico. Y empezó a trabajar después de hacer el servicio militar.

El realiza su trabajo en su taller con dos ayudantes, desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 18:00pm de la tarde. El se dedica al servicio técnico. El cliente nos comento que  hace cinco años atrás tuvo un  accidente en su vista izquierda  y eso le dificulta un poco su trabajo.

El cliente si está casado, y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos  de la casa. Y también 2 hijos y estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas para mejorar su negocio.  Para un futuro él desea tener   una casa propia para su familia, para asi poder tener su taller en un lugar propio.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilmer lives in Guayaquil. He says that he began working as a mechanic 12 years ago. He chose this line of work because he graduated from a technical school. Wilmer began working after he completed his military service.

He works at his shop with the help of two assistants. His schedule working as a service technician is from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Wilmer says that he was in an accident five years ago, so he has trouble seeing out of his right eye, which causes him a little difficulty in his work. He is married and his wife devotes herself to the household duties. They have two children who attend state schools.

With this loan, Wilmer will buy tools so that he can improve his business. In the future, he would like to have a house for his family and to acquire his own location for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools for his shop.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad. Cuenta con más de tres años desempeñándose como motorista de una mototaxi. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda. Con la inversión, podrá brindar a su hijo una vivienda más segura e higiénica para que pueda desarrollarse en mejores condiciones y con más espacio.
texts.en:
Claudio is 35 years old and has a two-year-old son. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for more than three years.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to improve his home. With this investment, he will be able to provide a safer and cleaner home for his son where he can grow up under better conditions and with more space.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né en Août 1978 à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa est marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  dans son village natal, une de préfecture de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Moussa est un mécanicien de profession depuis plus de huit ans. Pour faciliter à ses clients de d’acquérir des pièces auto de qualité d’occasion, il mène en parallèle avec son métier des activités d’achat-vente des pièces détachées. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois années avec laquelle il est à son sixième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
 Il compte acheter avec ce  nouveau  prêt une importante quantité de pièces détachées à savoir des bielles, arbre à came, pistons et jantes. Les marchandises (pièces) sont achetées sur place à travers le démontage des véhicules cass pour être vendues par pièces dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 140 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in August 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa - a village about six kilometres from the town of Sikasso - Moussa is married and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a large, traditional extended family in the village of his birth, in the borough of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Moussa is a mechanic by trade and has been doing this for over eight years. 
In order to assist his customers to obtain quality secondhand spare parts for their vehicles, he also buys and sells spare parts alongside the main business. He is much sought after by his customers, due to the quality of his parts. To meet the needs of his ever growing customer base, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution three years ago, and with whom he is now seeking his sixth personal loan. The previous loans have all been fully paid back.
With this new loan, he intends to purchase a large quantity of spare parts - in particular connecting rods, camshafts, pistons and wheel rims. The items are bought onsite, with him dismantling scrapped vehicles to sell for spare parts in his workshop. Thanks to this loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute towards the family's expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the remainder in the business.

loans.use: Pour acheter des pièces détachées cass

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil. Ella tiene 49 años de edad. Ella nos comenta que empezó con esta labor hace 10 años para así poder tener ingresos económicos extras para su familia, lo escogió porque se lo ofrecieron y le pareció interesante, se dedica a venta de cosmeticos por revitas.

Ella se dedica al comercio minorista de cosmeticos, perfumes, cremas. La clienta tiene dificultades al movilizarse porque desde la edad de 3 años sufre de Poliomielitis, lo que le impide realizar su trabajo con normalidad ya que esta en sillas de ruedas.

Ella está casada, su esposo es taxista. Tienen un hijo, y estudia en escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar productos para incrementar su negocio como cremas, perfumes, cosmeticos. 

El sueño de la clienta para un futuro, es tener su negocio propio un bazar grande en su casa  para con ese dinero poder pagarle una universidad privada a su hijo.
texts.en:
This client is 49 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She says that she began working 10 years ago so that she could earn extra income for her family. She chose to sell cosmetics through catalogs because it seemed interesting and for what it could offer her.

The borrower is a small businesswoman who sells cosmetics, perfumes, and crèmes. She has difficulty moving around because she has suffered from poliomyelitis for the past three years. This disease impedes her work on a routine basis, so she must get around in a wheelchair.

The borrower is married and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have a son who attends a state school. With this loan, she will buy products such as crèmes, perfumes, and cosmetics so that she can increase her business. Her dreams for the future include opening a large bazaar in her house and using the profits to pay for a private university education for her son.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Née en Juin 1967 à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso), Madame Ramatou est mariée et mère de six enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants en location à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Ramatou mène des activités  d’achat et de vente des condiments il y a plus de trente ans,  depuis très jeune, auprès de sa maman. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept  ans et elle a eu plusieurs  prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) avec une association des femmes à Kadiolo Noumousso et est maintenant au 6ème cycle au prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grossiste au niveau du marché où elle opère afin de servir les détaillantes de ce marché qui ont souvent du mal à s'approvisionner facilement.
Avec ce présent prêt, elle compte acheter 20 cartons de Tomate Concentrée, 10 cartons de Maggie, 5 sacs de graine de poivre, 5 sacs d’oignon séchés, 5 sacs de feuilles de Lorié et10 cartons de moutarde au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle compte revendre ses marchandises en gros au comptant et à crédit à ses camarades détaillantes du nouveau marché de Médine où elle mène son activité. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in June 1967 in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso), Ramatou is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented property in Hamdallaye, one of the neighbourhoods of the town of Sikasso. Ramatou has been trading condiments for over thirty years, since she was very young and alongside her mother.
With a view to better meeting the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join the credit program at Soro Yiriwaso approximately seven years ago. Since then she has had several group loans with a women's association in Kadiolo Noumousso, and is now on her sixth cycle of personal loans - all her previous loans have been fully repaid.
She wants to use this latest loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to become a wholesaler in the market where she works - so she can supply the market traders who often have trouble finding supplies. With this loan, she plans to buy twenty crates of tomato concentrate, ten crates of Maggie (stock cubes), five sacks of peppercorns, five sacks of dried onion, five bags of bay leaves and ten cases of mustard - from the 'grand marché' in Sikasso.
She plans to resell these goods in bulk - for cash and/or credit - to her trader colleagues from the new market in Médine where she runs her business. With the proceeds of this loan, she expects to generate a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which she will use to contribute to the family's living expenses, to pay the interest on the loan, and to invest the balance in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the small village of Sagarejo District in Georgia. Emzar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard, and produce wine to sell at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Emzar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Emzar will install gas equipment in his own car. After the gas equipment is installed he will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grains and wheat to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Ruth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Ruth has been farming bananas for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas and dry goods.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nawindsongti Group

texts.fr:
Mme NAWINEBARKA  est la représentante du groupe NAWINDSONGTI. Mme se porte bien. Elle est mariée  et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 06 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Elle transforme et vend du soumbala  depuis  1998 (15ans). Elle est aussi tisserante depuis quelques mois. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de Bissighin  en ville .Ses clients sont  les  femmes et hommes.
Elle veut  s’acheter  50 sacs de grains de néré pour la fabrication du soumbala et une balle de  fil de tisse.
 Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne aider à payer la scolarité de ses enfants  et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nawinebarka is the well-spoken representative of the Nawindsongti group. She is married and the mother of six children. The eldest is 22 and the youngest 5 years old. All six attend school, and she has no other dependents. 
She has been making and selling soumbala since 1998 (fifteen years), and she also began weaving a few months ago. She buys her supplies at the market in the town of Bissighin, and her customers are both men and women. She wants to purchase fifty sacks of néré seeds in order to make soumbala, and one roll of weaving thread. She wants to save her profits, and plans to assist with paying for the children's education as well as helping to take care of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fifty sacks of néré tree seed to make soumbala, and a roll of weaving thread.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a retail shop business in Tala town. She has operated it for the past three years and it has been profitable. She is 32 years of age and married with two children. This will be her first loan and she plans to use it to buy more goods to sell in her shop. Items she intends to buy include flour, sugar, detergents, milk and cooking fat. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en: Fredelina is a responsible mother who helps her husband in generating income. They aim to improve their standard of living in order to give their children a bright future. Despite the hardship of living, she has a strong determination to achieve their goals. She plans to improve her small variety store in order to earn a higher income. She is asking for additional capital of 12,000 PHP to buy more stocks of grocery items, charcoal, feeds and soft drinks to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, charcoal, feeds and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a fruit and vegetable selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Teresita is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Maha is a 32-year-old married young woman. She is a mother to one son and one daughter and her husband is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
For the past six months, Maha has been operating a beauty salon. She has many loyal customers because of her good reputation among them, which makes her project a successful one and a second source of income for the family. Because the project is just beginning, it is in need of more support.
Maha is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing women's cosmetics and accessories for her beauty salon. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable them to live in better conditions. Maha is looking to expand the beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: To purchase women's cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом проживает в районе Шахритус, расположенного в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Илхому 27 лет. У него жена и один маленький ребенок. Отец Илхома в данный момент находится на заработках за пределами страны. Сам Илхом зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занят в сфере животноводства более 5 лет и уже имеет достаточный опыт. Илхом запрашивает кредит для закупа коров и телят с дальнейшим их откормом и продажей. За счет прибыли он намерен сделать ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Ilhom lives in the Shahritus region, located in the south-western part of the Khatlon province of Tajikistan. He is 27 years old with a wife and one small child. Ilhom's father is currently working outside the country. 

Ilhom himself makes a living in cattle trade. He has worked in animal husbandry for more than five years and already has considerable experience. He is requesting a loan to purchase cows and calves to feed and resell. He intends to use the income to renovate his home and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves to feed and resell

loans.name: Qosimjon

texts.ru: Косимжон холостой молодой человек. Ему 20 лет. Он живет с родителями в районе Шахритус, в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Отец Косимжона занимается животноводством, а мать домохозяйка. После окончания школы Косимжон продолжил дело отца. Он тоже начал заниматься животноводством и уже два года как он занимается куплей и продажей скота. Косимжон запрашивает кредит для закупа мелко-рогатого скота с дальнейшим его откормом и продажей. За счет прибыли с деятельности он планирует жениться.
texts.en: Qosimjon is an unmarried young man. He is twenty years old. He lives with his parents in the Shahrituz region in the southwestern part of the Khatlonskiy region of Tajikistan. Qosimjon's father does animal husbandry and his mother is a housewife. After graduating from school Qosimjon continued his father's business. He also began to do animal husbandry and has been buying and selling cattle for two years now. Qosimjon is asking for a loan to buy small horned cattle for further feeding and resale. He plans to use the profit from the business to get married.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle for further feeding and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to equip a new workplace and to increase the quantity of kitchen equipment so she can resurrect her fire-damaged business.

loans.name: Karla Maribel

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer de 22 años de edad joven, luchadora, con deseos de superarse y de salir día a día adelante ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad el cual depende de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un  grado de educación de primaria completado y agradece el esfuerzo de sus padres por haberla apoyado hasta donde pudieron ya que ellos son de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirle ayudando. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de café y que junto a su esposo lo realiza hace cuatro años en un terreno que agradecen a DIOS por ser propio el cual pudieron comprar con los ahorros y el sacrificio puesto por mucho tiempo. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 5 Kilómetros al cual se trasladan diariamente en vehículo el cual pagan un pasaje de trasporte y en ocasiones a pie para darle la atención y mantenimiento posible a su plantación de café como la limpieza, poda, corte, abono, fumigación, etc. Su producto es comercializado y vendido con los intermediarios de la zona y vecinos que clasifican su producto como un producto limpio sano y con calidad.   

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, y otros para poder darle una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento a sus plantaciones de café ya que las plagas están a la orden del día y todo aquello que pueda contaminar y deteriorar.

Su sueño es lograr que su hijo crezca en un mejor ambiente, con mejores posibilidades para que el pueda estudiar y pueda ser una persona graduado universitaria mente y pueda aprovechar el patrimonio que hoy en día sus padres están formando para que implemente los conocimientos obtenidos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Karla, 22, is a hard-working young woman with a desire to get ahead.  She is married and has a five-year-old son who depends on her in all aspects.  She received an elementary education and is grateful to her parents for their efforts in helping her as much as possible givendespite their low income.  It was her parents who taught her about planting and growing coffee.  She and her husband have been in this business for four years farming their own land.  They are thankful to God that they were able to buy the land with their savings after much sacrifice.  The land is five kilometers away, so they have to pay for a transport ticket to get there and back daily.  Sometimes they walk to the plantation for maintenance issues such as weeding, cutting, fertilizing, fumigating, etc.  Their product is sold through intermediaries in the area.  The neighbors classify the product as being healthy, clean, and of good quality.

Currently, Karla is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her coffee plantation, in order to protect it from crop disease and other contaminants.

Her goal is to provide a better environment for her son so he can get a good education and a university degree.  She hopes he can take advantage of the assets his parents are working for, so he can make us of them to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other crop supplies.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est trésorière du groupe Tusaidiane,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, parmi les quels 4 ont déjà eu leurs diplômes. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente s’est investi dans la fabrication de braseros de foyers améliorer dans le cadre de la conservation de l’environnement et de  lutter contre la déforestation. Ses braseros sont très rationnels dans la consommation de l’énergie. Cette cliente a trouvé plus de succès dans ce domaine. Elle s’installe aux différents marchés. Elle commença cette affaire avec le crédit de Hekima, Il ya 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter l’argile, sables, tôles usés pour la fabrication. Elle ambitionne dans le futur, acheter un camion pour assurer la distribution et le transport de sables-argiles, payer  des émissions à la radio pour une large publicité de ses produits, créer des points de vente dans les quartiers. La rareté et la qualité de sable-argile est un défi majeur pour son entreprise. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima.
texts.en:
Masika is treasurer of the Tusaidiane group. She is married and the mother of seven children, four of whom already have their school diplomas. Her husband is a seller of various goods.
She is involved with the manufacture of brazier type fireplace grills, which help with environmental conservation and with combatting deforestation. Her braziers are very economical in fuel consumption, and she has found great success in this activity. She is establishing herself in several markets. She began the business with a loan from Hekima six years ago. This new loan will allow her to purchase clay, sand and used metal sheets for the manufacturing process.
Her goals for the future are to purchase a lorry to ensure the distribution and transport of sand-clay, to pay for radio commercials in order to get broad publicity for her products, and to create points-of-sale in local neighbourhoods. The scarcity and quality of sand-clay is a big problem for her business.
Finally, she warmly thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to buy clay, sand and secondhand metal

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 22 años , esta casada con Deodono de 28 años y tiene un hijo pequeño , con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de madera . Maribel se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un espacio dentro de su hogar ,este negocio es fruto del trabajo de las diversas actividades que desempeñaba en el campo junto a su esposo a través de la producción de cacao y café orgánico. Dentro de su mercadería comercial podemos hallar diversa variedad de cereales, productos envasados y de primera necesidad el cual expende normalmente a vecinos y amigos.Considera a su labor  muy buena en cuanto a los ingresos económicos que genera aportando de manera considerable al sustento de familia ,además de haber logrado entablar muchas amistades dentro de su localidad .Para mantener el normal desempeño de su negocio debe de surtir y abastecer su tienda con los productos de mayor demanda comercial y de preferencia al por mayor, ya que le permite obtener mayores ingresos .Desea a futuro seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para lograr la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble, esperando así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia .En está oportunidad desea contar con S/.4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para su negocio tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado, productos enlatados, baldes de aceite y cereales.
texts.en:
Maribel, 22, is married to Deodono, 28.  They live with their little boy in a wooden house.  Out of her home, Maribel runs a grocery store that she was able to set up thanks to having worked in different farm activities with her husband, such as growing cocoa and organic coffee.  She believes business is going well considering the income it generates and which is a considerable contribution to the household economy.  She has also been able to make many friends in the area.

In order to to keep her store running, Maribel must keep a stock of the most popular items and, if possible, buy them at wholesale prices so she can make a better profit.  In the future she hopes to continue working with as much motivation as she is known for in order to build a house out of stone.  This is so she can improve her family's quality of life.  

On this occasion, she is requesting 4,000 PEN to buy merchandise for the store such as sacks of rice, sugar, canned fish and other canned goods, oil and cereals.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Niyomwizero Group

texts.fr:
Véronique fait partie du groupe Niyomwizero et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura.Elle est cliente de Turame. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Fabien.
Elle prend soin de 5enfants qui étudient et 2 personnes adultes.

Elle faisait le commerce des habits au marché centrale de Bujumbura. Elle a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de 600000Fbu (383,39$) par l’incendie.

Elle comptait acheter une parcelle pour  servir de garantie  aux crédits   de gros montants.

 Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des habits à revendre.
texts.en:
Véronique is part of the Niyomwizero group and is one of the victims of the fire at the central market in Bujumbura. She is a client of Turame.

She lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Fabian, and takes care of five children attending school and two adults.

She sold clothes at the central market in Bujumbura, where she lost 600000 Fbu ($ 383.39) worth of goods in the fire. She intended to buy a plot of land to serve as collateral for large loan amounts.

With the credit loan obtained from KIVA , she will replenish her capital by buying clothes to sell.

loans.use: replenish her capital by buying clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente de 49 años es un hombre de amplia capacidad laboral, viudo y con un hijo de 17 años ,actualmente reside en una vivienda construida a base de madera .Vicente se dedica a la producción de barbasco pero se inició como trabajador en algunos terrenos de la ciudad logrando con el tiempo establecer su familia para posteriormente comprar un terreno propio . Su labor parte de realizar el cultivo de dichas plantaciones para posteriormente extraer las raíces de manera cautelosa ya que la planta es utilizada para la elaboración de repelentes .
