Vicente debe de tener siempre personal para dichas labores puesto que al culminar las tareas productivas en menos tiempo garantiza una buena calidad para los acopiadores de su localidad. Tiene planeado comprarse una parcela adicional para dedicarse a la producción de cacao orgánico al ser un producto muy asequible en su localidad. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .En está oportunidad requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para el pago a sus trabajadores , quienes se encargan de la extracción del barbasco.
texts.en:
Vicente, 49, is a man with a lot of work capacity.  He is a widower, has a 17-year-old son, and lives in a wooden house.  Vicente grows mullein for a living but he started out as a hired hand on other property in the city.  Eventually, he was able to set up a family and buy his own land.  His work entails growing the crops and later extracting the roots carefully, as the plant is used to make repellants.

Vicente always has to hire workers in order to shorten production time and guarantee an optimum quality for the area collectors.  He is planning on buying more land to produce organic cocoa since it is a product in abundance in the area.  This is his first Kiva loan and he is committed to paying it back on time.  On this occasion, he would like to have 2,000 PEN to hire workers who will handle the extraction of the mullein.

loans.use: To hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying clothes for resale

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es: Don Bartolo, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en un barrio del municipio de Puerto Cortes junto a dos de sus hijos y su esposa. Don Bartolo tiene su propio negocio desde hace 6 años el vende variedad de frutas y también ropa usada. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela, pone su venat a orilla d ela calle. Ha sido cliente de la organización por 12 ciclos con el actual. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para surtir de frutas y de ropa usada de la temporada de verano. Su plan es que el negocio siga en crecimiento para poder ayudad a su familia.
texts.en: Bartolo, 65, lives with his wife and their three children in a neighborhood of the municipality of Puerto Cortes.  Bartolo has been in business for six years selling different fruit and used clothing.  He works at home, selling close to the street, and has a good customer base.  He has been involved with the organization for 12 loan cycles, including this one, and is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL to buy fruit and used clothing for the summer season.  His plan is to continue expanding his business so he can help his family.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: replenish his capital by buying shoes for resale

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora ivania del socorro vive en la capital casada con dos hijos que actualmente se están preparando en la universidad.

Ivania tiene su negocio en su casa elabora los fines de semana riquísimos nacatamales unas de las comidas típicas por los nicaragüense elaborado a base de maíz,carne de cerdo, arroz, papa, tomate, cebolla envueltos con hoja de mata de platano  estos son vendidos los días viernes, sábado y domingo  el reto de día de la semana se dedica a la elaboración de adornos y venta de arreglos florales.

Solicita el crédito a kiva  para la inversión de los productos que utiliza en su negocio ya que su clientela ha aumentado  y esto le anima bastante porque su negocio va  creciendo y mejorando sus ganancias y esto le permite cubrir los gastos de universidad de sus hijos
texts.en:
Ivania del Socorro lives in the capital city and she is married, with two children who are preparing to go the university.

Ivania runs a weekend business from home making delicious nacatamales, a typical Nicaraguan food made with corn, pork, rice, potato, tomato and onion wrapped in banana leaves.  She sells them on Friday, Saturday and Sunday and the rest of the week she makes and sells floral arrangements.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy the products she needs for her business, since demand has increased and this motivates her to keep growing.  This will improve her income and allow her to cover her children's university costs.

loans.use: To buy corn and meat.

loans.name: Hosiayt

texts.ru: Хосият женщина 1989 года рождения, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Хосият не имеет высшего образования на данный момент, но на данный момент поступила в педагогический институт , параллельно работает в школе. Зарплата у нее небольшая, ее почти не хватает на жизнь. Супруг из-за трудностей с работой в городе поехал в Россию на заработки.  Семья очень молодая и они испытывают трудности.  Они стараются не унывать , так как это ничего не изменит в жизни. Из-за холодной зимы Хосият обратилась в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит она приобрела печку. Это ее основной обогрев в доме. Она очень благодарно нашей организации за поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Hosiyat was born in 1989, she is married and has two children. Hosiyat does not have higher education at this time, but she has enrolled in the Pedagogical Institute and simultaneously works in the school. She has a small salary and it's not enough to get by. Her husband went to Russia to find work because of difficulties in finding a job in town. Their family is very young and they are experiencing hardship. They try to be in high spirits because being despond will not change anything in life. Because of the cold winter Hosiyat has come to MDO Arvand for a loan. She used it to buy an oven. This is her main heating supply at home. She is very thankful to this organization for the support in the hard times.

loans.use: to purchase of electrical oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit in season.

loans.name: Roger Alberto

texts.es:
El joven Roger  Alberto vive en la cuidad de Managua se caracteriza por ser un joven emprendedor,  trabajador con muchos deseo de superación tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos perecederos y de consumo diario, decidió  tener su negocio para ayudarse en los gastos de sus estudios.

Solicita un crédito a ceprodel y kiva para invertirlo en  en el negocio y de esta manera incrementar su inventario  para mejorar sus ganancias  que  le sirve para ayudar a su familia.

Roger esta agradecido con ceprodel por los créditos que se le han otorgado, ya que le han servido de mucho en el crecimiento de su negocio y se han mejorado sus condiciones de vida .
texts.en:
Roger Alberto is a young man who lives in the city of Managua. He is described as being a young entrepreneur who is hardworking and who really wants to get ahead. He has a small store where he sells perishable products of daily consumption. He decided to have his own business to help pay for his educational expenses. 

He is asking for a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to invest in the business and thus increase his inventory to improve his earnings that he will use to help his family.

Roger is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans that it has given him, because they have been very useful for growing his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, soda, oil, etc.

loans.name: Norlan Enríquez

texts.es:
El señor norlan Enrique vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una empresa es un joven  soltero con muchos deseo de superación responsable, honestos  vive en la casa de sus padres.

 está solicitando un crédito para ayudarle a su madre en la reparación  de la vivienda para la compra de bloques, cemento y pago de mano de obra.

 Y así de esa manera aportarles a sus padres para la mejora de  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Norlan Enrique lives in the city of Managua. He works in a business. He is a young, unmarried man who really wants to get ahead. He is responsible and honest and lives in his parents' home. 

He is asking for a loan to help his mother do some home repairs. He will buy cement blocks, cement and pay for the labor costs. This way, he can help his parents do home improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Purity's Group

texts.en: Purity is a twenty-four year old mother of three and a dryland farmer. She grows and sells cassava at the local market, but yields are low due to minimal rainfall. She also sells charcoal to earn money for her family. Purity says, "Joining KOMAZA is like investing in my future" and the program will help her "realize her future dreams." With the profits from her tree farm, Purity plans to educate her children and meet their basic needs, such as food and shelter.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as an honest and determined woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for household use. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy materials to construct a water tank. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail shop and a butcher shop within 5 years.. She hopes after buying the water tank materials, she will finish construction after one month. Esther has had five loans from SMEP DTM which she managed to pay successfully. Previously, she had taken a loan of KES 100,000.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a water storage tank

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children who all go to school. She has one additional family member whom she cares for - her mother. She sells bread, butter, milk, etc. at the market in a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy loaves of bread, butter, packets of tea leaves, coffee, cocoa and packets of milk. Her major business challenges are on and off electricity and the fluctuating prices of milk. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also build a house for her family. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, paying for utility bills and food.

loans.use: To buy more packets of milk, loaves of bread, butter and packets of tea leaves

loans.name: Marina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Marina Enriqueta es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, madre soltera de una hija la que está estudiando una carrera universitaria. 

Desde hace 22 años se dedica a la labor de maestra la que le ha permitido educar y darle el pan de cada día a su hija sin la ayuda de su padre.

Cada día ejerce su trabajo con amor y dedicación porque su país necesita de la ayuda de estas personas para salir adelante y de la pobreza que se vive.

 Ella da clases en una comarca ubicada a 10 km de dicho municipio y le entristece ver en el campo la pobreza en que se vive, los niños recibiendo clases debajo de un árbol porque no hay una escuela de concreto pero lo importante es el querer aprender a leer y escribir, además que la escuela la hacen los alumnos y la maestra.


Actualmente está solicitando a los inversionistas de Kiva que le financien un crédito para Pago de universidad y compra de útiles escolares de su hija, ya que con su bajo salario muchas veces se le hace difícil cubrir estos gastos porque para poder ir a la universidad tiene que viajar hasta León y lo más importante que quiere heredarle una carrera universitaria para que en un futuro se defienda.
texts.en:
Marina Enriqueta is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She is a single mother; her daughter goes to the university. Marina has worked as a teacher for 22 years, an activity that has made it possible for her to raise and feed her daughter without her father’s help. She works everyday with love and dedication because her country needs this type of people in order to get ahead and overcome poverty.

Marina teaches in a small community located 10 km from the municipality. She feels very sad when she sees how poor people are; kids receive class under a tree because there are no concrete buildings. However, what is important is their will to learn to read and write. Besides, a school is made of its students and teachers.

Marina is asking Kiva investors to finance her loan to pay for her daughter’s university fee and for some school supplies that she needs, since the salary she receives is not enough to cover these expenses. The university is located in León, so she has to travel there for her lectures. The biggest legacy she wants to leave her daughter is a higher education degree so that she can have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university and to buy school supplies for her.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school.

Lorena raises hogs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorena has been in the hog raising business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lorena would like to save more money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 54 years old from a small village of Kobuleti district. She has a large family: a husband, three sons, a daughter-in-law, an infant granddaughter and her parents-in-law. Ketevan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but had no success. Her loan request was always rejected, because of her low income and her family's poor living conditions. 

Until recently, the only source of the income for the family was from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of vegetables, which are sold locally in open markets. In addition she has newly started a business where she buys and sells clothing. But still, it is hardly enough to buy food for her family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ketevan requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions available to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Ketevan will purchase more clothing to sell. She will be able to expand her business and this will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 28 years old married. She has two children, one of whom is in school.

Marichu is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. Marichu requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marichu has been in this business for 1 year now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is now 46 years old and married to a farmer. They were gifted with five children and they are raising their family in a rural community. They aim to educate all their children so that they will find a good job someday. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Susan wants to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. Due to her inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 7,000 PHP to buy additional to buy additional rice, cooking oil, seasonings vegetables and other grocery items to sell. Through her hard work and strong determination, Susan believes that she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, cooking oil, seasonings vegetables and other grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 10 años donde vende variedad de comidas como almuerzos, pollo frito con tajadas y otras. Ella vende en su casa y trabaja en base a pedidos los que entrega a domicilio también. Ha sido cliente de la institución por varios años. Con el préstamo que solicita son 26 ciclos de préstamos y es por un monto de 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar insumos para la elaboración de comidas. Su plan es aumentar las ventas vendiendo nuevos platillos de comida  para generar ingresos y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 48, is a single mother of three children. She lives in the suburbs of San Pedro Sula. María has had her own business for ten years, selling all kinds of foods such as meals, fried chicken with fries, etc. She works at home, on demand, and she offers home delivery.

María has been a client of the institution for several years. This loan will be part of the 26th cycle. She is requesting 10,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy supplies. Her plan is to increase her sales, and thus her income, by offering new recipes. This will help her to pay for her son’s studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food, such as rice, beans, flour, butter, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes to resell

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es: Doña Gloria, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene mas de un año de haber establecido su propio negocio donde elabora y vende arreglos florales y flores para todo tipo de ocasión. También vende variedades como papel para regalos y otros. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo por 4,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como flores, bases, musgos etc. para elaborar arreglos florales y también vender las flores. Su plan es tener mayor inventario de productos que ofrecer y logar que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old.  She is a single mother with two children and lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  Over a year ago, she established her own business where she makes and arranges floral arrangements and flowers for all types of occasions.  She also sells items such as wrapping paper for gifts and others.  Her business is located in her home.

She has decided to request her third loan of 4,000 lempiras in order to purchase materials such as flowers, vases, mosses, and other items to make floral arrangements and also to sell the flowers.  Her plan is to have a better inventory of products to offer and succeed in having her children prepare to be professionals.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make floral arrangements.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Theresa, 44, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, her business partner and a father of her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Theresa operates a food stall. She sells arroz caldo (Chinese congee) and barbecued meat. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like pork, rice, condiments and seasonings. 

Ma. Theresa hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like pork, soy sauce and other ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es: Jose, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. El siempre se ha dedicado al comercio en la venta de ropa y calzado. Hace un año decidió también vender productos lácteos como queso, mantequilla y quesillo. La venta de lácteos la realiza de manera ambulante utilizando una motocicleta para movilizarse en varias aldeas. Esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de préstamo por un monto de 16,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa de temporada de verano para vender y no descapitalizarse con el negocio de los lácteos. Su meta es seguir trabajando duro para poder llevar a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: José, who is 41, is married with one child and lives in a village in the municipality of Arizona, in Atlántida department.  He has always sold clothing and footwear.  A year ago he also decided to start selling dairy products, such as cheese, butter and quesillo (string cheese), in various villages which he travels around by motorcycle.  For this fifth loan cycle, he is requesting the sum of 16,000 Lempiras to buy summer clothing to sell and avoid draining capital from his dairy business.  His ambition is to continue his hard work and to be able to put food on the table every day for his family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 30-year-old single mother of three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. In order to support her family, she decided to set up a salon and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land and provide the basics to her family. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university and set up rental houses for each of them so as to secure their future. Inadequate capital hinders her business plan while her dream is to own a modern beauty parlor. Joyce is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
El señor Celedonio y su esposa la señora Laura son originarios de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí, tiene más de 13 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, cuenta con dos hijos que están estudiando la universidad. El señor Celedonio tiene mas de 8 años dedicándose a la venta de futas preparadas (con limón y chile) en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en material que es desechable y  fruta ya que desean iniciar la venta con otros dos triciclos, así vender en más partes y tendría más clientes e ingresos a su familia, también podría ayudar a otras personas dándoles empleo.
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Celedonio and his wife Laura are originally from the city of San Luis Potosí.  For more than 13 years, they have lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo.  They have two children who are studying at university.  For more than 8 years, Celedonio has worked selling fruit prepared with lime and chile in different parts of the city.

He is requesting a loan to purchase disposable items and fruit.  He wants to start selling with two other carts so that he can sell in more areas and have more customers and income for his family, and also be able to help others by giving them a job.  He will use part of the income he earns from his business to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his business selling fruit.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is age 35, a married woman with 1 kid, age 4 years. Florence runs a hostel restaurant where she gets her main income. She has hopes of starting up her own shop selling clothing, but her challenge is failure to get customers during the rainy season and inadequate capital.Florence intends to use the loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is engaged in the activity of tailoring. She started this business ten years ago. Estelita is married with three grown-up children. Two are working, and her youngest child is still studying. She and her husband both know the tailoring business, so the couple works together in order to earn for a living. 

Estelita would like to buy garments, threads and needles because she has accepted much work for wedding activities this upcoming month. Therefore, she is seeking financial assistance amounting to 10,000 PHP. This amount will really help her to sustain all of her family's household expenses and send her youngest child to a higher level of education. She hopes that this loan will help the growth of her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy garments, threads and needles for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shalik

texts.en: Shalik is a 38-year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.He trades in agricultural produce such as beans and groundnuts and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land for farming and rear cows for milk production. Price fluctuation and prolonged drought affect the business while his vision is to be the leading produce supplier in the region. Shalik intends to use the loan to buy groundnuts and beans to resell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally is 40 years old and married with 5 children in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She runs a fishing business to earn a living. She has been working at her business for over 5 years and earns 3,500 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets. She hopes and dreams is to have better life and to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Salomao

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente, sem filho, reside em casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe
É agricultor mas no entanto pretende abraçar a actividade comercial pelo que com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar diversos produtos alimentar para o inicio da sua actividade. 
No futuro deseja ter uma casa mais condigna, melhorar as suas condições de trabalho e adquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte da sua mercadoria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar no sentido de vencer as dificuldades financeiras do presente e do futuro.
texts.en:
Salomao is married with no children, lives in his own house and supports his mother.

He's a farmer but he plans to embrace commercial activities and as such he intends to purchase various food products with this loan to begin this activity.

In future Salomao hopes to have a better home, improve his working conditions and purchase a vehicle to help with transporting his products. To this end he commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work hard to overcome financial difficulties both today and in future.

loans.use: purchase various food products to begin his commercial activity

loans.name: Regineta

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente mãe de 6 filho sendo um de maior idade, é a terceira esposa do agregado familiar.
Tem o negocio como a fonte de sua sobrevivência pelo que pelo presente empréstimo pretende comprar peixe e mantas para revenda.
Futuramente pretende diversificar e aumentar o volume do seu negócio como forma de responder a dinâmica do mercado, pelo que pagar o crédito devidamente lhe garantirá mais confiança com a instituição.
A condição climatérica tais como o vento tem acondicionado a estas actividade de na medida em que quando há mau tempo os pescadores não se fazem a pesca e este constitui o maior desafio.
texts.en:
Regineta is married and the mother of 6 children, one of whom is of age. She is the third wife in her family unit.

Her business is her source of survival so she plans to use this loan to buy fish and blankets for resale.

In future Regineta intends to diversify and increase the volume of her sales so as to respond to market dynamics. To this end, paying off her loan as due will guarantee her the trust of the Institution.

Her biggest challenge is the weather as when there is bad weather and a lot of wind, the fisherman cannot go out fishing.

loans.use: buy fish and blankets for resale

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 45 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years. Bernard has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells sugar and salt. 

To help expand his business, Bernard  has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business and buy more sugar and salt to sell he will also add in his second business of a studio. This will help Bernard to generate greater profits and to pay tuition fees for his children. Bernard hopes that in the future he will be able to meet his customers' needs. 

Bernard  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bernard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy more sugar and salt to sell, he will also add in his second business of a studio.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Makeera

texts.en:
Makeera is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 9 children with 8 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Makeera has been working hard to manage his poultry feed business. 

To help expand his business, Makeera has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add stock to the business and buy more maize flour to sell, and will help Makeera to generate greater profits and increase the income level of the family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Makeera is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Makeera who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add stock and buy more maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food such as beans and groundnuts to sell in her restuarant.

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
Solteiro vivendo com os pais e não tendo mais alguém sobe sua responsabilidade
É carpinteiro de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar meios circulantes (madeira, cola e verniz) para o desenvolvimento da sua actividade.
No futuro pretende trabalhar no sentido de construir uma carpintaria de raiz e devidamente equipada, pelo que, a periodicidade de reembolso irá constituir o seu compromisso de forma a gracejar mais confiança na Instituição.
O seu maior desafio é a contratação de mão obra necessária para o inicio da actividade.
texts.en:
Rui is single, lives with his parents and is not responsible for anyone else.

He's a carpenter by profession and with this loan he plans to buy wood, glue and varnish to develop his activities.

In future he intends to build a carpentry workshop from the ground up with all the right equipment. To this end he will periodically pay off his loan as expected in order to be trusted by the Institution for further loans he requires.

His greatest challenge is being able to hire the people necessary to start the building work.

loans.use: buy wood, glue and varnish to develop his carpentry activities.

loans.name: Nuliat

texts.en:
Nuliat  is 48 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married  and has 8 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Nuliat has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Nuliat  has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stork more items such as soda, rice, flour to sell, and will help Nuliat  to generate greater profits and buy food for the family . Nuliat  hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her family. 

Nuliat  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuliat  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stork more items such as soda, rice, flour to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 48 years old and lives in the town of Busia, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, who are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her produce of maize and cassave flour. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more produce of maize flour to sell, which will help Rehema to generate greater profits. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce of maize flour to sell,

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 34 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba  in the Iganga  region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Justine  has been working hard to manage her salon which sells hair products.

To help expand her business, Justine  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products for the salon services, and will help Justine  to generate greater profits and meet customers' needs.  Justine  hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her working capital. 

Justine  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products for the salon

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is a married woman with five children aged between the ages of 3 and 12 years. She has been running a tailoring business for three years. Benter purposes to buy more material for making shorts, dresses and blouses with a KES 20,000 loan. She faces a business challenge of not having enough clothes available to sell. She plans, in the future, to run a large scale tailoring retail store in her hometown. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy material for making shorts, dresses and blouses to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rafayiri

texts.en:
Rafayiri is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Rafayiri has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells items like sugar, flour, and rice. 

To help expand his business, Rafayiri has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and add different items. This will help Rafayiri to generate greater profits and increase his family's income. Rafayiri hopes that in the future he will be able to buy land. 

Rafayiri is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rafayiri who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve his business and diversify his products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past eight years, Grace has been working hard to manage her produce business , which sells maize flour, rice, g-nuts and beans. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more g-nuts (peanuts) and dry maize to sell and will help Grace to generate greater profits and income. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to add to the business. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more g-nuts (peanuts) and dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Having benefited from a previous Kiva loan, Flavia is determined to keep focused on permanently changing the lives of her household. Recently she received some goats from a local government-funded agriculture project that is aimed at alleviating poverty. She is dedicating her energy to looking after the goats, as well as stocking more of the local breeds for cross-breeding, so that she will have a better quality breed. The proceeds will help to meet her family needs adequately, and to help her dependents. She is a hard-working and shrewd woman.

loans.use: to buy baby goats to raise and sell in the near future.

loans.name: Darlison

texts.en:
Darlison is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Darlison has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other items.

To help expand her business, Darlison has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, and flour to sell, and will help Darlison to generate greater profits and look after the family. Darlison hopes that in the future she will be able to earn lots of profits from the business.

Darlison is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Darlison who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and flour to sell.

loans.name: Glorious

texts.en:
Glorious  is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura  in the Hoima  region of Uganda. She is married  and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Glorious  has been working hard to manage her bookshop, which sells books and other stationaries . 

To help expand her business, Glorious  has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge and a camera that will be used for her side business, and will help Glorious  to generate greater profits and improve on the family welfare . Glorious  hopes that in the future she will be able to business expansion. 

Glorious  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Glorious  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a camera that will be used for her side business,

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 40 years old, married with three children who live with him plus two dependents who also live with him. He operates a boutique majoring in the sale of new clothes and shoes, it is located in Kagadi town and he has been operating this business since 1995 as a major source of income to look after the family.

Justus wants a loan of 1,400,000 UGX to pay tuition for two of his children and his dependents. He has been using money from the business to pay the fees but this time, he didn't want to take money out the business because the capital would be reduced, rather he wants to be pay back the loan in small installments.The major challenge Justus faces is limited capital, competition in the market as well as the seasonality of the business. His dream is to educate his children and dependents and also diversify his sources of income.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 49 years old and from the Akhaltsikhe district. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two infant granddaughters. Elza requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly income of her husband, working as a driver. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Elza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Elza will begin trade with jewelry. She plans to purchase jewelry at wholesale prices in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, and then resell it among her villagers with a price markup. This will increase the income of the family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with jewelry.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose, es soltero y no tiene hijos , viven en casa de sus tíos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco    de la ciudad de El Alto.
El actualmente cursa el nivel universitario y ahora trabaja como chofer asalariado con la movilidad de sus tíos, en la ciudad de El Alto.  Los fines de semana también tiene ingresos extras como árbitro de futsal (futbol de salón).
El crédito lo requiere para pago de los créditos en la Universidad y continuar con sus estudios superiores y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Jose es llegar a ser profesional.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose is single and has no children. He lives at the house of his aunt and uncle that is located in the District of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto.

Jose currently attends the university and is also working in the city of El Alto as a salaried chauffeur with his uncle’s vehicle. On the weekends, he earns extra income as a referee for an indoor soccer club. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay his expenses at the university so that he can continue his higher education. This will allow him to improve his quality of life.

Jose’s dream is to become a professional. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay his university expenses.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su mama la cual falleció, ella cuenta con un ambiente el cual es usado como dormitorio, sala, y cocina, la habitación es de adobe y el piso es de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como secretaria en el tribunal supremo electoral percibiendo un salario mensual, ella se encarga de sus gastos de transporte y alimentación.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de la matrícula en la Universidad donde piensa estudiar leyes.
El sueño de Lourdes Alicia es el de terminar sus estudios y poder trabajar mejor y percibir un salario mejor.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Lourdes is single and has no children.  Her mother passed away and she lives in her house, which has a space used as a bedroom, living room, and kitchen.  The house is adobe and the floor is cement.  The house is located in the Alto Chijni area in the city of La Paz.  Lourdes currently works as a secretary at the supreme electoral court and receives a monthly salary.  She pays her food and transportation costs.  

She is requesting this loan to pay the matriculation fee at the university where she would like to study law.  Lourdes Alicia's dream is to finish her education and be able to get a better job with a better salary.  

This is her third loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the matriculation fee at university to study law.

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso is 53 years old. He lives in the small village of Chokhatauri District with his mother, who is has a retirement pension. Soso requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where maize and nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally earning hardly enough for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Soso is requesting a loan from Credo to for a start-up family business. His loan request was approved by the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startups credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Soso will a purchase plastic cutting machine so he will be able to get orders and make plastic equipment and earn an income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a plastic cutting machine.

loans.name: Marie Flor

texts.en:
Marie Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumpia-wrapper-making business in the Philippines. (Lumpia wrappers are used for spring rolls, egg rolls and won ton, e.g.)  She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, etc. for her lumpia-wrapper-making business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rossette

texts.en:
Rossette is a single mother widowed at the age of 40. She now lives with her four children. Her main source of income depends on unreliable odd jobs to ensure that she and the children survive. She later realized that more work was not forthcoming and decided to join a group of coffee farmers. 

Currently, Rossette has a big coffee and banana plantation from which she gets most of her income. Her biggest challenge now is that she wants to buy enough fertilizers for her plantation; she has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from UGAFODE for that purpose. She hopes with the fertilizers, her production will increase and so will her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Apophia

texts.en:
Apophia is 27 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 child with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Apophia has been working hard to manage her Agro chemical store, which sells seed fertilizers. 

To help expand her business, Apophia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy seed fertilizers for her to sell, and will help Apophia to generate greater profits and save money to pay fees for the children. Apophia hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive . 

Apophia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apophia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy seed fertilizers for her to sell in her business.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is a widow, age 56, and a mother of seven children. She dwells in Kamwokya–Kifumbira zone with her seven children.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to complete part of her rental houses. She has been in the rental business since 1993, after the death of her husband, so that she can get more income to educate her children and put up a house where she can reside with her children.

However, it’s quite challenging since most of the tenants take too long to pay her. This affects her cash flow since some of the children end up being chased from school for incomplete tuition. She hopes that with the completion, she will increase her income and therefore solve some of her challenges.

loans.use: To complete her rental houses.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lhagvasuren is 46 years old and lives with his 2 children in an apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His son Enhbold, age 27, works at a mining company as a driver, and his daughter Enhchimeg, age 25, works at a local company. Lhagvasuren has been running a shoe retail business since 1996. He has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. 

He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase an inventory of seasonal shoes to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking, optimistic and responsible man who also has a good record with his previous loans at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of seasonal shoes to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Jaquelina

texts.pt:
Casada e mae de 6 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, feijão, frangos, peixe, caldo e outros) para reforçar o stock da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja casar-se oficialmente e adquirir uma viatura que possa ajudar a família e no seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir sobressair na concorrência do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jaquelina is married and the mother of six school-aged children. She lives in her own home and also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has a business selling a variety of goods, and she plans to use this loan to purchase products (rice, beans, chickens, fish, stock, etc.) to increase her stock.
In the future she hopes to get married and buy a vehicle that can help her family and her business. She is committed to paying off this loan so she can apply for further loans from Hluvuku. 
Her greatest challenge is to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, beans, chickens, fish, stock, etc.) to restock his business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children ranging in age from 2 to 9 years old. He describes himself as an ambitious and honest man. 

John operates a retail business where he sells water to customers. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the local residents from the village. He describes his biggest business challenge as having inadequate water storage facilities, which enable him to supply water to his customers. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water storage containers so he can supply water to his customers. His business goal is to be a major supplier of water within five years. This is the first loan John is taking with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers so he can supply water to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's mason business

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru:
Ёрмахмад живет в районе Шахритус в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ёрмахмаду 43 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию, а дочери учатся в школе. Жена Ёрмахмада не работает, она ведет домашнее хозяйство. Сам Ёрмахмад занимается земледелием. 
Сейчас Ёрмахмад хочет начать новый бизнес. Его интересует животноводческая деятельность, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. С этим намерением Ёрмахмад просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. В будущем за счет прибыли он планирует увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой новый бизнес.
texts.en: Yormahmad lives in the Shahrituz region in the south-west area of the Khatlon region of Tajikistan. He is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. His eldest son has gone to Russia to earn money, and his daughters are in school. His wife does not work outside the home. Yormahmad works in agriculture. Now he wants to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry, as this is a profitable occupation that is not too physically demanding. For this reason, he is seeking a loan to get into buying and selling cattle. He plans to use the income generated by this loan for the future increase of his herd and the expansion of his new business.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Glarice's Group

texts.en:
Glarice is a twenty-five-year-old mother of seven children and a widow. She supports her family through maize farming, though a lack of capital for fertilizer and pesticides is a detriment to her agricultural business. 

Glarice says she is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program "because KOMAZA is doing development in our village and I want to be a part of it." With the profits from her tree farm, Glarice wants to educate her children and build a home with electricity and running water for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 41-year-old mother who runs a small variety store in order to supplement her husband's income. She aims to make the business profitable in order to continue sending her three children to school. She planned to acquire different household commodities to sell, but she does not have enough capital. 

For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, rice and soft drinks to sell. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has a strong determination to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, rice and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marilou has a business selling woven palm mats (used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. Marilou has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more woven palm mats to sell. She earns an additional income from raising cattle.

Marilou has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more woven palm mats to sell.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 20-year-old single man. His father is employed yet earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past one and a half years, Fouad has operated a small sewing workshop where he sews clothes for customers. This has been a profitable project.

Fouad is requesting a $2,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing an additional sewing machine to provide better quality work to his loyal customers. This will increase his sales and improve Fouad's income.

In the photo, Fouad is in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 45-year-old married man and a father to three sons and three daughters. Hani has been working in selling used home appliances, but the income he gets from his project is not enough to cover all his family's needs.

For the past two years, Hani has had a small sewing workshop in his house for sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Hani is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new sewing machine to provide better quality to his loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's income, which will enable Hani to offer better living conditions to his family.

Hani appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 50 years old with six children. She lives Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 45,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fetilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fetilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 26 años, vive en casa propia con su novia la Srta. Alicia, no tienen  hijos, es cobrador desde hace mas de 4 años, y solicita este crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya para poder empezar a trabajar por sí mismo y dedicarse a la venta ambulante, ya que cuenta  con experiencia en el ramo y  clientela formada, también ya se lo conoce por casi todas las zonas donde trabajaba como cobrador.
Quiere comprar hamacas, sabanas, edredones y demás, con lo que podrá empezar a trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Robert is 26 years old. He lives in his own house with his girlfriend, Alicia. They do not have any children. He has been a collector for more than four years. He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to start working for himself as a mobile salesman. He has experience and a client base. Also, he is familiar with almost all the areas where he works as a collector. 
He wants to purchase hammocks, sheets, quilts and other items in order to start working and move forward.

loans.use: purchase hammocks, sheets, quilts and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Maria helps her husband in generating income to satisfy their family's needs. She is 59 years old and has five adult-age children. She aimed to improve her small variety store in order to increase her income. She planned to increase her product offerings, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, charcoal and hog feeds to sell. Through her patience  and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, charcoal and hog feeds to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda, a married mother of two, is 31 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, where she owns farmland. She plants and harvests rice to sell to make a living. She has been in business for 5 years and earns about 40,000 PHP each month. Esmeralda joined GDMPC in 2009. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting. She is hoping that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting.

loans.name: Manuela Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Manuela vive en Guayaquil. Ella tiene 47 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta como empieza su trabajo, hace algún tiempo ella realizo una fiesta y fue cuando hizo los bocaditos y a todos les encantaron y así fue que comenzo a hacerles pedidos las personas que fueron a la fiesta y ahora se gana la vida con esta labor. Ella hace  su trabajo por medio de pedidos y los realiza sola. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos y tiene un bazar. Las dificultades que ha tenido en su trabajo son por parte de los ladrones que hay en el sector, puesto que esto le impide vender hasta muy tarde. 
Ella está casada, y su esposo es maestro albañil, tiene un niño pequeño y estudia en el jardín.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería para seguir con el negocio, mercadería como: harina, pollo, especies dulces, etc. Su sueño pera un futuro es de tener una grande repostería para poder brindar trabajo a otras personas necesitadas, de escasos recursos humano.
texts.en:
Sra. Manuela is 47 years old and lives in Guayaquil. She says that she began working some time ago when she prepared appetizers for a party. The attendees enjoyed the food and began placing orders with her. Now she earns her living by working in this manner. Manuela gains work by accepting orders and performs her duties alone.

In addition to selling snacks, Manuela also manages a bazaar. The difficulties in her business include having to deal with thieves that exist in the area. This prevents her from making sales late in the evening. Manuela is married and her husband is a master bricklayer. They have a young son who is in kindergarten.

With this loan, Manuela will buy supplies to continue her business such as flour, chicken, spices, sweets, and other items. Her dream for the future is to have a large pastry shop where she can provide jobs to other people since she will be in need of employees.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, spices, sweets, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in his Kiva profile photo.

Nahed is a 43-year-old married man and a father of two daughters and two sons. For the past four years, Nahed has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project because it is located in a good area in the market and has many loyal customers, but also from time to time it needs more support to cover the costs.

Nahed is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new refrigerator, which he will use for preserving food at his store, and also to pay for installing additional shelves. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and install additional shelves in his grocery store.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome is a 52-year-old maize farmer and trader. She has four children and is a widow whose husband has passed away. Salome's maize trade is affected by other buyers who sell at competitively lower prices. 

When asked why she is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program, Salome said, "After it was explained to me, I decided I loved what KOMAZA is doing as I have always planted trees for my own use." 

She is requesting a loan to buy eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizers as well as to pay for plantation maintenance support.

With the profits she earns from her tree farm, Salome plans to buy a plot of land in the local town and build a house.

loans.use: to buy eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizers as well as to pay for plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more frozen and processed meats. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more processed and frozen foods needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narcisa hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more processed and frozen foods such as hot dogs, ham, stuffed meats and other frozen foods for her business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
This is Maxima, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She manages her household with the help of her children while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Maxima operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands (meals) costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maxima hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is grateful for the first loan he received. His business is making great progress. He now intends to increase the number of motorcycles he owns. Sammy is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle. Despite the challenge of competition due to the high number of motorcycles, Sammy believes he can make it through in the business. His desire is to purchase a three-wheeler in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 22 years old, married and has one child. Due to financial constraints, she runs a small variety store to generate income. She has been operating the business for almost three years, and usually earns a profits of only 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. She aims to increase her income in order to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of her child. To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock of rice, dried fish, vegetables, canned goods, eggs, noodles, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She hopes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, dried fish, vegetables, canned goods, eggs, noodles, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar más mercadería, como lo es plátanos verdes entre otros alimentos; también cemento, ladrillo, lamina, otros para  hacerle mejoras a su vivienda. 
El crédito anterior  le ayudo para comprar para el negocio, tambien ha realizado de sus ganancias mejoras a su vivienda.  Las condiciones de vida han mejorado para su familia y en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan now that she needs to buy more supplies, like plantains and other things. She will also buy cement, bricks, metal sheets and other materials to improve her house.

The previous loan helped her with her business. With the profits she has made, she has improved her house. Her family’s living conditions have improved and her children's studies are going well.

loans.use: to buy plantains and some building materials for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new hubcaps that he can sell.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en:
Nabat continues to work hard with her home-based sewing and tailoring business. She successfully repaid her previous loan of $1,500 and would like to make further improvements.

With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nabat is one of the many Iraqi woman who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.  Nabat would like to have a nicer work area as she works on her customers' special orders so she is requesting a loan for $3,000, which she will use to improve her work area.

loans.use: to improve her work area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Lavin

texts.en:
Lavin is a young Iraqi woman. She is 25 years old, married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Lavin is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Lavin has six years experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She is using an old sewing machine to work on custom orders, making dresses for women and children and also fabric household items. She would like to improve her work conditions, and with the $2,000 USD loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, renew her work area. She hopes that with the renovation work, her time spent by the machine will be a little more pleasant.

Lavin is under 30 years old and qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work conditions and renew her work area.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio,ya que le es de mucha ayuda. Este le servirá para comprar huevos por mayoreo y así aumentar sus ingresos.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar sus inventarios y obtener más entradas de dinero. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y las condiciones económicas  han incrementado, pero necesita optimizar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is asking for a new loan due to her need to invest more in her business.  It will help a lot and will allow her to buy eggs wholesale, increasing her profits.

Her previous loan allowed her to improve her inventory and obtain more income.  The needs of her family have remained the same while the cost of living has increased, so she needs to further improve her business.

loans.use: buy eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (her mother). She operates a retail shop that she rents at the market. She has been in this business for the last two years. She is also a school bursar, from which she gets additional income. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bag of sugar, flour, rice, and jerrycans of cooking oil. Her major business challenges are thieves and the fluctuating prices of commodities. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked retail shop, sell on a wholesale basis only and also build her own house. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, paying for utility bills and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, rice, maize flour and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (her old parents). She operates a bar from a shop that she rents on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy local gin, crates of beer and soda. Her major business challenges are defaulters, thieves and on-and-off electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked bar, educate her children up to university  and also buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, requiere de un nuevo crédito,ya que le permitirá comprar carne de res, chorizos, costilla, hueso entre otros, así poder sustir su negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  mucho, ya que logro comprar más productos para la venta de carnes, huesos, etc. La familia se ha mantenido en su nivel, sus ingresos ha mejorado. Su sueño es tener su propio local, agregar otro tipo de productos, ayudar a sus nietos y realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Erlinda needs another loan because it will allow her to buy beef, sausage, ribs, bones, and other things to stock her business.

The previous loan helped her a lot because she managed to buy more products to sell meat, bones, etc.  Her family has maintained its standard of living and her income has improved.

Her dreams are to have her own store, add other products, help her grandchildren, and make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy beef, sausage, ribs, bones, and other things

loans.name: Sozan

texts.en: Sozan is a 31-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and the mother of one child. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sozan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. Sozan has a year of experience with her small home-based sewing and tailoring activity, which she hopes to grow because of her creativity and attract more clients with special orders for dresses and household items made with fabrics. She is currently using an old sewing machine and would like to buy an embroidery machine and some nice good quality fabrics and raw materials to work with. She hopes that, with these purchases, she will be able to attract more customers and provide them with quality creative products. To be able to pay for these items, she took out a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $2,000.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and nice good quality fabrics and raw materials for her home-based sewing and tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a fishing business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over six years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials, such as hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as hooks and nets, for her business.

loans.name: Raef

texts.en: Raef is a 34-year-old married man and a father to one son, who is seven years old. For the past nine years, Raef has been buying used electrical goods and selling them to his customers. His is the only project of its kind in his area, and the business has good customer demand because of its affordable prices. This has been a profitable project, and the only source of income for the family. Raef is applying for a $2,000 loan from FATEN to cover the cost of buying new and modern used electrical goods, such as washing machines, refrigerators and television sets, to sell to his customers. This will attract more customers and increase Raef's sales, which will increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. Raef is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to buy used electrical goods, such as washing machines, refrigerators and television sets, to resell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  , de 45 años de edad , está casada con Amancio con quien 3 hermosas hijas, juntos viven en la casa que compraron hace algunos años. Rosa se dedica a la siembra de frutas de la región tales como: manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, melones, duraznos, granadillas, entre otras frutas secas, las cuales son vendidas en el local acoplado en su vivienda , en donde recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor , lleva en este negocio un promedio de 7 años , sin embargo lo que más le gusta de cultivar y vender  frutas es que sus hijos pueden estar junto a ella  y  consumen lo que vende cuidando su alimentación; “vendiendo frutas he podido construir mi casa, educar a mis hijos, mantener los gastos de mi casa ” comenta Rosa , a la vez que resume que su negocio es muy rentable para ella. Para  el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y surtirla de más variedad de frutas para satisfacer a sus clientes. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su trabajo. 
Rosa invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus frutas.
texts.en:
